transportation company's stock valued at $2,018,000 after buying an additional 3,039 shares during the last quarter.  
Envestnet Asset Management Inc. raised its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 1.9% during the 3rd quarter. Envestnet 
Asset Management Inc. now owns 41,343 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $2,744,000 after 
buying an additional 789 shares during the last quarter.  Finally, Pacer Advisors Inc. raised its stake in shares of  
Ryanair by 51.3% during the 3rd quarter. Pacer Advisors Inc. now owns 531 shares of the transportation company's 
stock valued at $35,000 after buying an additional 180 shares during the last quarter. Institutional investors and 
hedge funds own  49.15% of the company's stock.  
RYAAY has been the topic of a number of analyst reports. Bank of America initiated coverage on Ryanair in a 
research report on Monday, September 30th. They set a "buy" rating on the stock. JPMorgan Chase & Co. cut 
Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a research report on Monday, July 29th. ValuEngine  
upgraded Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Wednesday, October 2nd. 
BidaskClub upgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "strong-buy" rating in a research report on Tuesday, October 
15th. Finally, Raymond James dropped their target price on Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" 
rating on the stock in a research report on Thursday, July 11th. Six analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, 
three have issued  a hold rating, five have assigned  a buy rating and one  has issued  a strong buy rating to the 
stock. The company currently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $75.33. 
NASDAQ:RYAAY  opened at $73.71 on Friday. The stock has a market capitalization of $16.67 billion, a PE ratio of 
14.34 and a beta of 0.82. The company has a quick ratio of 1.08, a current ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 
30,500 Shares in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Bought by FNY Investment Advisers LLC
0.79. The stock's 50-day moving average price is $66.92 and its 200-day moving average price is $66.76. Ryanair 
Holdings plc has a 52 week low of $55.75 and a 52 week high of $89.03.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its quarterly earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 EPS for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. 
The firm had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 billion. Ryanair had a 
net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%.  Sell-side analysts expect that  Ryanair Holdings plc will 
post 4.15 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Holdings Reduced by Segantii Capital Management Ltd
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Holdings Reduced by Segantii 
Capital Management Ltd
American Banking and Market News
October 25, 2019 Friday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 817 words
Body
Ryanair logo Segantii Capital Management Ltd decreased its position in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) 
by 62.6% in the 3rd quarter, according to the company in its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission. The fund owned 71,017 shares of the transportation company's stock after selling 118,983 shares 
during the period. Ryanair makes up  approximately  0.6% of Segantii Capital Management Ltd's holdings, making 
the stock its 27th biggest position. Segantii Capital Management Ltd's holdings in Ryanair were worth $4,699,000 at 
the end of the most recent quarter.  
A number of other hedge funds and other institutional investors have also recently bought and sold shares of 
RYAAY. Pacer Advisors Inc. boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 51.3% in the third quarter. Pacer 
Advisors Inc. now owns 531 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $35,000 after acquiring an 
additional 180 shares in the last quarter.  Huntington National Bank lifted its stake in  Ryanair by 21.2% during the 
second quarter. Huntington National Bank now owns 2,014 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$129,000 after purchasing an additional 352 shares during the last quarter.  Manchester Financial Inc. acquired a 
new stake in  Ryanair during the second quarter valued at approximately $35,000.  LPL Financial LLC lifted its 
stake in  Ryanair by 21.4% during the second quarter. LPL Financial LLC now owns 4,219 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $271,000 after purchasing an additional 743 shares during the last 
quarter.  Finally, Envestnet Asset Management Inc. lifted its stake in  Ryanair by 1.9% during the third quarter. 
Envestnet Asset Management Inc. now owns 41,343 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$2,744,000 after purchasing an additional 789 shares during the last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional 
investors own  49.15% of the company's stock.  
Several equities research analysts recently commented on RYAAY shares. ValuEngine  upgraded shares of 
Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Wednesday, October 2nd. Bank of America 
initiated coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Monday, September 30th. They issued a "buy" 
rating for the company. Societe Generale downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a 
research report on Tuesday, August 6th. Credit Suisse Group lowered shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to 
an "underperform" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 23rd. Finally, Raymond James dropped their price 
target on shares of Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" rating on the stock in a research note on 
Thursday, July 11th. Six analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have assigned  a hold rating, five 
have given a buy rating and one  has assigned  a strong buy rating to the company's stock. The stock presently has 
an average rating of "Hold" and an average target price of $75.33. 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Holdings Reduced by Segantii Capital Management Ltd
Ryanair stock  traded down $0.65 during trading hours on Friday, reaching $73.43. 10,177 shares of the stock were 
exchanged, compared to its average volume of 534,356. The company has a market cap of $16.71 billion, a P/E 
ratio of 14.29 and a beta of 0.82. The company has a current ratio of 1.08, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity 
ratio of 0.79. Ryanair Holdings plc has a twelve month low of $55.75 and a twelve month high of $89.03. The stock 
has a 50 day moving average of $66.61 and a two-hundred day moving average of $66.76.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus estimates of $1.14 
by $0.06. The firm had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $2.60 billion. 
Ryanair had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%.  On average, analysts expect that  Ryanair 
Holdings plc will post 4.15 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Lauda to Start Vienna - Shannon Direct Flights
Lauda to Start Vienna - Shannon Direct Flights
Newstex Blogs 
FFT.ie
October 25, 2019 Friday 11:11 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 433 words
Byline: Mark Murphy
Body
Oct 25, 2019( FFT.ie: http://www.fft.ie Delivered by Newstex)             https://www.fft.ie/lauda-to-start-vienna-
shannon-direct-flights/29181#            https://www.fft.ie/lauda-to-start-vienna-shannon-direct-flights/29181# 
denied:whatsapp://send?text=Lauda%20to%20Start%20Vienna%20%E2%80%93%20Shannon%20Direct%20Fligh
ts%20           https://www.fft.ie/lauda-to-start-vienna-shannon-direct-flights/29181            https://www.fft.ie/lauda-to-
start-vienna-shannon-direct-flights/29181# 
mailto:?subject=Lauda%20to%20Start%20Vienna%20%E2%80%93%20Shannon%20Direct%20Flights...Y=I%20fo
und%20this%20article%20interesting%20and%20thought%20of%20sharing%20it%20with%20you.%20Check%20it
%20out:%20           https://www.fft.ie/lauda-to-start-vienna-shannon-direct-flights/29181            
https://www.fft.ie/lauda-to-start-vienna-shannon-direct-flights/29181#respond 
Low 
cost 
airline 
Lauda 
has 
announced it is to start a direct service beween Vienna and Shannon Airport in 2020. The airline, owned by 
Ryanair, will commence the route in March 2020 and will operate it twice weekly as a summer service on 
Wednesdays and Saturdays. 
Prices will begin as low as €33.99 one day. This is the second Ireland service announced by Lauda this month, with 
a new route between Knock Airport and Palma de Mallorca also scheduled to begin next March. The new route will 
be very welcome at Shannon Airport, which has lost over 120,000 seats this year due to the grounding of the 
Boeing 737 Max plane and the subsequent scaling back of services by Norwegian and Air Canada. The route was 
secured with the help of measures in Budget 2020 to fund regional airport development. 'This is very positive news 
for Shannon as not alone do we get a scheduled service to one of Europe's most visited cities and a strong inbound 
market for tourists to Ireland, but we are also getting a new carrier on the runway here as well. We have been 
working closely with Lauda and their parent Ryanair, to deliver this service and are looking forward to the airline 
commencing operation in the New Year,' said Andrew Murphy, Managing Director, Shannon Airport. Tourism 
Ireland has welcomed the news. Niall Gibbons, CEO of Tourism Ireland, said: 'Today's announcement is good news 
for tourism to the west coast of Ireland - expanding the options for Austrian holidaymakers to come and experience 
the spectacular Wild Atlantic Way. We look forward to co-operating with Lauda, Shannon Airport and other tourism 
partners, to maximise the promotion of inbound travel on this new service.' Lauda currently operates a fleet of 22 
Airbus A320 aircraft. 
Lauda to Start Vienna - Shannon Direct Flights
Load-Date: October 25, 2019
End of Document

RYAAY. Bank of America began coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Monday, September 30th.

from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" rating for the company in a research report on Thursday, July 11th.

company currently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $75.33.Shares of NASDAQ

beta of 0.82. The company has a current ratio of 1.08, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79.

Zacks: Brokerages Expect Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) to Announce $4.00 Earnings Per Share
Zacks: Brokerages Expect Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) to 
Announce $4.00 Earnings Per Share
American Banking and Market News
October 24, 2019 Thursday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 807 words
Body
Ryanair logo Wall Street brokerages expect Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) to post earnings per share 
(EPS) of $4.00 for the current quarter, according to            Zacks Investment Research . Zero analysts have issued 
estimates for Ryanair's earnings. Ryanair posted earnings per share of $4.42 in the same quarter last year, which 
indicates a negative year over year growth rate of 9.5%. The business is expected to report its next earnings results  
on Monday, October 28th. 
According to Zacks, analysts expect that Ryanair will report full-year earnings of $4.15 per share for the current 
year, with EPS estimates ranging from $4.10 to $4.18. For the next financial year, analysts expect that the company 
will report earnings of $5.47 per share, with EPS estimates ranging from $4.74 to $5.85. Zacks Investment 
Research's earnings per share averages are a mean average based on a survey of sell-side research analysts that 
cover Ryanair. 
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company 
reported $1.20 EPS for the quarter, beating the Zacks' consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair had a net 
margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%. The company had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, 
compared to analysts' expectations of $2.60 billion.  
A number of brokerages have issued reports on RYAAY. BidaskClub upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "buy" 
rating to a "strong-buy" rating in a research note on Tuesday, October 15th. ValuEngine  upgraded shares of 
Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Wednesday, October 2nd. Credit Suisse Group 
lowered shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underperform" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 
23rd. Bank of America began coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Monday, September 30th. They 
set a "buy" rating on the stock. Finally, Societe Generale lowered shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" 
rating in a research note on Tuesday, August 6th. Six equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell 
rating, three have assigned  a hold rating, five have issued  a buy rating and one  has assigned  a strong buy rating 
to the stock. The company presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average target price of $75.33.

company's stock valued at $391,000 after acquiring an additional 1,684 shares during the period.  ETRADE Capital

average of $66.76. Ryanair has a 52-week low of $55.75 and a 52-week high of $89.03.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

(NASDAQ:RYAAY) during the 3rd quarter, according to the company in its most recent filing with the Securities & 
Exchange Commission. The fund purchased 1,138,260 shares of the transportation company's stock, valued at 
approximately $75,557,000. Ryanair accounts for approximately  11.7% of Trinity Street Asset Management LLP's 
holdings, making the stock its biggest position. Trinity Street Asset Management LLP owned about 0.51% of 
Ryanair as of its most recent filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission.

transportation company's stock worth $391,000 after purchasing an additional 1,684 shares during the period.

purchasing an additional 2,162 shares during the period.  Atria Investments LLC grew its holdings in  Ryanair by

company's stock worth $11,592,000 after purchasing an additional 11,588,444 shares during the period.  Tower 
Research Capital LLC TRC purchased a new stake in  Ryanair in the second quarter worth about $137,000.

owns 7,198,559 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $461,715,000 after purchasing an additional 
594,607 shares during the period. Institutional investors own  49.15% of the company's stock.  
A number of brokerages have weighed in on RYAAY. Societe Generale cut shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to 
a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, August 6th. Raymond James cut their price objective on shares of Ryanair 
from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" rating on the stock in a report on Thursday, July 11th. Bank of

average is $66.28 and its 200-day moving average is $66.76. The company has a market cap of $16.79 billion, a

reported $1.20 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. The 
firm had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $2.60 billion. Ryanair had a 
net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%.  As a group, analysts expect that  Ryanair Holdings plc will 
post 4.15 EPS for the current fiscal year.

Zacks: Brokerages Expect Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) to Announce $4.00 Earnings Per Share
Zacks: Brokerages Expect Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) to 
Announce $4.00 Earnings Per Share
Newstex Blogs 
Week Herald
October 24, 2019 Thursday 4:06 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 903 words
Body
Oct 24, 2019( Week Herald: https://weekherald.com Delivered by Newstex)  Wall Street brokerages expect Ryanair 
Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) to post earnings per share (EPS) of $4.00 for the current quarter, according to 
Zacks Investment Research[1]. Zero analysts have issued estimates for Ryanair's earnings. Ryanair posted 
earnings per share of $4.42 in the same quarter last year, which indicates a negative year over year growth rate of 
9.5%. The business is expected to report its next earnings results on Monday, October 28th.According to Zacks, 
analysts expect that Ryanair will report full-year earnings of $4.15 per share for the current year, with EPS 
estimates ranging from $4.10 to $4.18. For the next financial year, analysts expect that the company will report 
earnings of $5.47 per share, with EPS estimates ranging from $4.74 to $5.85. Zacks Investment Research's 
earnings per share averages are a mean average based on a survey of sell-side research analysts that cover 
Ryanair.Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 EPS for the quarter, beating the Zacks' consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair 
had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%. The company had revenue of $2.60 billion for the 
quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $2.60 billion.

rating to a "strong-buy" rating in a research note on Tuesday, October 15th. ValuEngine[2] upgraded shares of

lowered shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underperform" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July

set a "buy" rating on the stock. Finally, Societe Generale lowered shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" 
rating in a research note on Tuesday, August 6th. Six equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell 
rating, three have assigned a hold rating, five have issued a buy rating and one has assigned a strong buy rating to 
the stock. The company presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average target price of $75.33.Several 
hedge funds have recently added to or reduced their stakes in the stock. BB...orp boosted its holdings in shares of

Austria 's Lauda to expand in Palma
Austria's Lauda to expand in Palma
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
October 23, 2019
Copyright 2019 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 202 words
Body
Lauda (OE, Vienna) will expand its presence in Palma de Mallorca with first flights from the Spanish island to non-
German speaking destinations planned in the Summer 2020 season, Routes Online has reported. The Austrian 
subsidiary of Ryanair (FR, Dublin Int'l) will launch its own services from Palma de Mallorca to Klagenfurt in Austria 
and Knock in Ireland, both operated 2x weekly from March 31, 2020. In addition, the carrier will also operate select 
flights of its parent airline from Palma to multiple destinations in Europe.

Joramco wins C-check contract from Ryanair E Ryanair has selected Jordanian MRO provider Joramco to 
complete heavy checks on its Boeing 737-800 fleet.
Joramco wins C-check contract from Ryanair;  E Ryanair has selected 
Jordanian MRO provider Joramco to complete heavy checks on its Boeing 
737-800 fleet.
Flight International
October 17, 2019
Copyright 2019 DVV Media International Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: FLIGHTGLOBAL.COM
Length: 227 words
Body
Ryanair has selected Jordanian MRO provider Joramco to complete heavy checks on its Boeing 737-800 fleet.
Joramco says Ryanair has booked two parallel maintenance lines for the work, scheduled to begin in November 
through to the end of March 2020.
The deal represents the first collaboration between Ryanair and Amman-based Joramco.
Ryanair performs a majority of heavy checks at in-house facilities in Glasgow, Lithuanian city Kaunas and Wroclaw 
in Poland, the airline says in its 2019 annual report.
That network of facilities provides sufficient capacity to complete routine maintenance checks for the group's 737-
800 and Airbus A320 fleet, the carrier notes.
However, it adds that it subcontracts seasonal checks to third-party MRO providers and "expects to be dependent 
on external service contractors for A320 and 737 heavy maintenance for the foreseeable future".
Joramco chief executive Jeff Wilkinson sees the Ryanair deal as "the beginning" of a partnership with the low-cost 
carrier.
"We look forward to a long-term relationship," he states.
The MRO provider will "set new standards of excellence in line with the Ryanair's expectations", vows Wilkinson.
Separately, Joramco has disclosed a contract with Turkish cargo carrier MNG Airlines to complete C-checks on 
three A300s and one A330 between December and February.
MNG has been a Joramco customer since 2012.
Joramco wins C-check contract from Ryanair E Ryanair has selected Jordanian MRO provider Joramco to 
complete heavy checks on its Boeing 737-800 fleet.
Load-Date: October 18, 2019
End of Document
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Raised to 'Strong-Buy' at BidaskClub
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Raised to 'Strong-Buy' at BidaskClub
Newstex Blogs 
DailyPolitical
October 17, 2019 Thursday 1:07 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 680 words
Body
Oct 17, 2019( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) was 
upgraded by research analysts at BidaskClub[1] from a "buy" rating to a "strong-buy" rating in a research note 
issued on Tuesday, BidAskClub[2] reports.Several other analysts have also recently weighed in on the stock. 
Raymond James dropped their price target on shares of Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" 
rating for the company in a research note on Thursday, July 11th. Societe Generale cut shares of Ryanair from a 
"buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Tuesday, August 6th. 
ValuEngine[3] raised shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Wednesday, 
October 2nd. Morgan Stanley assumed coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Wednesday, 
September 18th. They issued an "underweight" rating for the company. Finally, Bank of America assumed coverage 
on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Monday, September 30th. They issued a "buy" rating for the company. 
Six investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have issued a hold rating, five have issued a 
buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating to the stock. Ryanair currently has an average rating of "Hold" 
and an average target price of $75.33.Ryanair stock[4] opened at $72.49 on Tuesday. The firm has a 50 day simple 
moving average of $63.98 and a 200-day simple moving average of $66.79. Ryanair has a 1-year low of $55.75 
and a 1-year high of $89.03. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a current ratio of 1.08 and a quick ratio 
of 1.08. The stock has a market cap of $16.43 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 14.10 and a beta of 0.82. Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company 
reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair had a 
net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%. The business had revenue of $2.60 billion during the 
quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $2.60 billion. Equities analysts expect that Ryanair will post 4.15 
earnings per share for the current fiscal year. Several hedge funds have recently modified their holdings of RYAAY. 
Manchester Financial Inc. acquired a new stake in Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth approximately $35,000. 
Pacer Advisors Inc. lifted its holdings in Ryanair by 51.3% during the 3rd quarter. Pacer Advisors Inc. now owns 
531 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $35,000 after buying an additional 180 shares in the last 
quarter. NumerixS Investment Technologies Inc acquired a new stake in Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth 
approximately $90,000. Westwood Holdings Group Inc. acquired a new stake in Ryanair during the 2nd quarter 
worth approximately $114,000. Finally, Huntington National Bank lifted its holdings in Ryanair by 21.2% during the 
2nd quarter. Huntington National Bank now owns 2,014 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$129,000 after buying an additional 352 shares in the last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional investors 
own 49.16% of the company's stock. Ryanair Company ProfileRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries,

Tuesday, BidAskClub[2] reports.RYAAY has been the subject of several other research reports. JPMorgan Chase 
.... downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a research note on Monday,

buy rating to the stock. The stock presently has an average rating of "Hold" and an average target price of

$89.03. The company has a 50-day moving average price of $63.98 and a 200 day moving average price of $66.79. 
The company has a market cap of $16.43 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 14.10 and a beta of 0.82. Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company 
reported $1.20 EPS for the quarter, beating the Zacks' consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair had a net 
margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%. The firm had revenue of $2.60 billion during the quarter, 
compared to the consensus estimate of $2.60 billion. As a group, equities analysts forecast that Ryanair will post 
4.15 EPS for the current year. Several institutional investors have recently bought and sold shares of the company. 
Manchester Financial Inc. purchased a new position in Ryanair during the second quarter valued at approximately 
$35,000. Pacer Advisors Inc. grew its holdings in Ryanair by 51.3% in the third quarter. Pacer Advisors Inc. now 
owns 531 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $35,000 after purchasing an additional 180 shares 
during the last quarter. NumerixS Investment Technologies Inc purchased a new position in Ryanair in the second 
quarter worth $90,000. Westwood Holdings Group Inc. purchased a new position in Ryanair in the second quarter 
worth $114,000. Finally, Huntington National Bank grew its holdings in Ryanair by 21.2% in the second quarter.

European ADRs Move Higher in Wednesday Trading
European ADRs Move Higher in Wednesday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
October 16, 2019 Wednesday 10:48 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 223 words
Body
 American Depositary Receipts of European stocks were trading 0.16% higher at 1,023.57 on the BNY Mellon 
Europe Select ADR Index on Wednesday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by biopharmaceutical companies DBV Technologies (DBVT), and Genfit 
(GNFT), which rose 4.9% and 2.5% respectively. They were followed by financial services company ING Groep 
(ING), and biopharmaceutical company Cellectis (CLLS), which climbed 2.3% and 2.2%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by semiconductor company ASML (ASML), and biotech firm Zealand 
Pharma (ZEAL), which dropped 3.4% and 2.8% respectively. They were followed by 3D printer company 
Materialise (MTLS), and furniture maker Natuzzi (NTZ), which were down 1.8% each.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by pharmaceutical company Avadel (AVDL), and Royal Bank of 
Scotland (RBS), which rose 2.3% and 2.2% respectively. They were followed by data and analytics provider RELX 
PLC (RELX), and biopharmaceutical company NuCana (NCNA), which were up 1.2% and 0.3%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by Trinity Biotech (TRIB), which fell 7.1%, followed by specialty 
pharmaceutical firm Motif Bio (MTFB), airline operator Ryanair (RYAAY), and mining company Rio Tinto (RIO), 
which lost 3.6%, 1.6%, and 1.4% respectively.
Price: 7.96, Change: +0.33, Percent Change: +4.33
Load-Date: October 17, 2019
End of Document

Ryanair to enter Armenian market Budget carrier Ryanair is to enter the Armenian market, with initial services 
early next year from the capital Yerevan and the ....
Ryanair to enter Armenian market; Budget carrier Ryanair is to enter the 
Armenian market, with initial services early next year from the capital 
Yerevan and the city of Gyumri.
Flight International
October 16, 2019
Copyright 2019 DVV Media International Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: FLIGHTGLOBAL.COM
Length: 93 words
Body
Budget carrier Ryanair is to enter the Armenian market, with initial services early next year from the capital Yerevan 
and the city of Gyumri.
Ryanair says it will open a link from Yerevan to Milan Bergamo and Rome Ciampino in January.
It will then develop services from Gyumri to Memmingen, near Munich, in summer 2020, and expand from Yerevan 
to Berlin Schonefeld.
The airline uses a fleet of Boeing 737-800s.
Ryanair describes Armenia as "one of Europe's fastest-growing tourism destinations". All the new routes will be 
served twice-weekly, the carrier adds.
Load-Date: October 16, 2019
End of Document

Ryanair ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Stock Price Up 6.1%
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Stock Price Up 6.1%
Newstex Blogs 
Transcript Daily
October 12, 2019 Saturday 3:07 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 707 words
Body
Oct 12, 2019( Transcript Daily: https://transcriptdaily.com Delivered by Newstex)  Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) rose 6.1% during trading on Friday . The stock traded as high as $74.31 and last traded at 
$73.58, approximately 783,500 shares traded hands during trading. An increase of 12% from the average daily 
volume of 701,911 shares. The stock had previously closed at $69.34.RYAAY has been the topic of several recent 
research reports. 
Bank of America initiated coverage on shares of Ryanair in a report on Monday, September 30th. They set a "buy" 
rating on the stock. BidaskClub raised shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on 
Tuesday, October 1st. ValuEngine[1] raised shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on 
Wednesday, October 2nd. Morgan Stanley initiated coverage on shares of Ryanair in a report on Wednesday, 
September 18th. They set an "underweight" rating on the stock. Finally, Societe Generale lowered shares of 
Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, August 6th. Six equities research analysts 
have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have issued a hold rating and six have issued a buy rating to the 
company's stock. Ryanair presently has an average rating of "Hold" and a consensus target price of $75.33.The 
company has a current ratio of 1.08, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79. The company's fifty day 
moving average is $62.33 and its 200 day moving average is $66.78. The company has a market cap of $16.56 
billion, a P/E ratio of 14.32 and a beta of 0.82. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings 
results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company reported $1.20 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, 
topping analysts' consensus estimates of $1.14 by $0.06. The business had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, 
compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 
18.39%. Analysts anticipate that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.08 EPS for the current year. Institutional investors 
have recently made changes to their positions in the business. BB...orp grew its holdings in Ryanair by 38.1% in the 
2nd quarter. BB...orp now owns 6,103 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $391,000 after acquiring 
an additional 1,684 shares during the last quarter. ETRADE Capital Management LLC boosted its stake in shares of 
Ryanair by 11.3% during the 2nd quarter. ETRADE Capital Management LLC now owns 21,229 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $1,362,000 after purchasing an additional 2,162 shares in the last quarter. 
First Pacific Advisors LP boosted its stake in shares of Ryanair by 9.3% during the 1st quarter. First Pacific 
Advisors LP now owns 78,303 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $5,868,000 after purchasing 
an additional 6,690 shares in the last quarter. Atria Investments LLC boosted its stake in shares of Ryanair by 
368,237.8% during the 2nd quarter. Atria Investments LLC now owns 11,591,591 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $11,592,000 after purchasing an additional 11,588,444 shares in the last quarter. 
Ryanair ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Stock Price Up 6.1%
Finally, Tower Research Capital LLC TRC bought a new stake in shares of Ryanair during the 2nd quarter valued at 
about $137,000. 49.04% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds. Ryanair 
Company Profile (NASDAQ:RYAAY[2])Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-
passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also 
involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related 
services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car 
hire, and travel insurance through its Website.Featured Story: What is operating income?[3] [ 1]: 
http://www.americanconsumernews.net/scripts/click.aspx?ValuEngine=1...bol=RYAAY

EasyJet ( EZJ )
EasyJet (EZJ)
Financial Times (London, England)
October 12, 2019 Saturday
Edition 1, European Edition
Copyright 2019 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: MONEY;FEATURES; Pg. 10
Length: 258 words
Body
Capacity growth for the full 2020 financial year is expected to be at the lower end of easyJet's historic range 
Investors in airlines are often sensitive to any perceived difficulty in passenger numbers not keeping up with 
increases in capacity.
This could be behind the significant slide in easyJet's share price following a preliminary trading update for the year 
to September.
While the number of passengers carried increased by 8.6 per cent to 96m, this did not keep pace with a 10.3 per 
cent increase in capacity to 105m seats available, leading to a 1.4 percentage point decline in load factor to 91.5 
per cent.
Strikes at British Airways and Ryanair benefited easyJet in its second half. This, along with self-help initiatives" to 
drive assenger yield, mean that eadline pre-tax profit is expected to be between £420m and £430m, towards the 
upper end of previous guidance.
Total revenue per seat at constant currency for the second half is expected to increase by about 0.8 per cent, better 
than management's previous assessment that it would be "slightly down", due in part to the strike action disruption 
at competitors.
The increase in capacity also contributed to an increase in total headline cost for the full year, expected to be up 
around 12 per cent, with higher fuel costs at about £1.42bn and adverse foreign exchange movements also 
impacting on that figure.
EasyJet ( EZJ )
Excluding fuel, cost per seat at constant currency is expected to fall by around 0.8 per cent, despite the impact of 
storms and technical issues at Gatwick airport. Julia Faurschou
Load-Date: October 12, 2019
End of Document

Drunk Passenger Vomited On Co-Traveler, Removed From Plane, Video Shows
Drunk Passenger Vomited On Co-Traveler, Removed From Plane, Video 
Shows
Newstex Blogs 
International Business Times News
October 10, 2019 Thursday 10:45 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 381 words
Body
Oct 10, 2019( International Business Times News: http://www.ibtimes.com Delivered by Newstex)  A Spirit Airlines 
flight's take-off was delayed after a passenger vomited in a co-traveler's hair. The incident took place aboard a flight 
from Chicago to Baltimore, Maryland, on Wednesday morning.Speaking to ABC7 Eyewitness News[1], an 
unidentifiedpassenger said the passenger who threw up was drunk and was removed the flight. 
The other passengers too were deplaned. The crew then cleaned the aircraft following which the flight took-
off.Meanwhile, the woman on whom the passenger had vomited was forced to wash her hair in a sink. A video 
shared by the unrelated passenger showed a flight attendant helping the woman clean the vomit out of her hair. 
Another video showed the passengers being deplaned.However, troubles were not over yet. Minutes after take-off, 
two drunk passengers locked themselves in the bathroom, causing another delay.The incident comes a few months 
after some Ryanair passengers [2]were filmed shouting and vomiting on a flight from Manchester to Croatia. The 
passengers, who were a group of party-goers, stormed into the flight and refused to listen to the crew when asked 
not to yell. A video of the incident showed the passengers yelling before one of them vomits and passes out amid 
laughter from his mates.Calling the situation as that of "a nightclub without the music,' a co-passenger said, "It was 
like being in a jungle with wild animals. It was hell on earth. It was the worst flight of my life. It was absolutely 
appalling. The only way I can describe it is like being in a nightclub without the music 10,000ft above the ground. 
They were shouting, chanting and the crew could not calm them down. They were uncontrollable. No one could 
calm them down. It was completely unacceptable. All of them were drunk.' A Spirit Airlines plane is parked on the 
tarmac as another Spirit Airlines passenger aircraft taxis after landing at Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport, 
Dec. 12, 2018. Photo: Photo by Robert Alexander/Getty Images [ 1]: https://abc7chicago.com/travel/drunk-
passenger-vomits-in-womans-hair-on-spirit-flight-/5607372/ [ 2]:            https://www.ibtimes.com/uncontrollable-
airline-passengers-filmed-shouting-vomiting-hell-earth-flight-2806004

End of Document

European ADRs Move Higher in Wednesday Trading
European ADRs Move Higher in Wednesday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
October 9, 2019 Wednesday 10:32 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 232 words
Body
 American depositary receipts of European stocks were trading 0.62% higher at 986.55 on the BNY Mellon Europe 
Select ADR Index on Wednesday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by biopharmaceutical company Genfit (GNFT), and software firm SAP 
(SAP), which rose 2.7% and 2.6% respectively. They were followed by kidney dialysis company Fresenius Medical 
Care (FMS), and biotech company Forward Pharma (FWP), which were up 2.3% and 2.2%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by biotech firm ERYTECH Pharma (ERYP), and biopharmaceutical 
company DBV Technologies (DBVT), which fell 6.5% and 3.8% respectively. They were followed by medical device 
company Edap  (EDAP), and furniture maker Natuzzi (NTZ), which lost 3.7% and 1.6%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by biopharmaceutical companies Adaptimmune Therapeutics (ADAP), 
and Mereo BioPharma (MREO), which climbed 7.9% and 6.4% respectively. They were followed by airline operator 
Ryanair (RYAAY), and construction materials supplier CRH (CRH), which were up 4.6% and 1.1%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by biotech company Autolus Therapeutics (AUTL), and 
pharmaceutical firm Avadel (AVDL), which dropped 2.9% and 1.7% respectively. They were followed by Trinity 
Biotech (TRIB), and biopharmaceutical firm GW Pharmaceuticals (GWPH), which were off 1% each.
Price: 1.09, Change: +0.08, Percent Change: +7.43
Load-Date: October 10, 2019
End of Document

Ryanair logo News headlines about Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) have trended somewhat positive this week, 
according to InfoTrie Sentiment Analysis. InfoTrie identifies negative and positive news coverage by reviewing more 
than 6,000 news and blog sources in real-time. The firm ranks coverage of public companies on a scale of negative 
five to positive five, with scores nearest to five being the most favorable. Ryanair earned a media sentiment score of 
1.20 on their scale. InfoTrie also assigned media headlines about the transportation company an news buzz score 
of 0 out of 10, indicating that recent news coverage is extremely unlikely to have an impact on the stock's share 
price in the next few days.

•
Ryanair to launch a Marrakech-Zaragoza route in March 2020 - Yabiladi in English  (en.yabiladi.com)
Shares of RYAAY stock  traded up $3.00 during mid-day trading on Wednesday, hitting $69.01. The company's 
stock had a trading volume of 13,622 shares, compared to its average volume of 695,240. The company's fifty day 
simple moving average is $61.56 and its 200-day simple moving average is $66.81. Ryanair has a 52 week low of 
$55.75 and a 52 week high of $89.03. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a 
current ratio of 1.08. The company has a market cap of $14.86 billion, a PE ratio of 13.43 and a beta of 0.82.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of 
$1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%. The firm had revenue of 
$2.60 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 billion.  On average, equities analysts 
anticipate that  Ryanair will post 4.08 earnings per share for the current year.  
A number of brokerages have recently commented on RYAAY. Morgan Stanley began coverage on Ryanair in a 
research note on Wednesday, September 18th. They issued an "underweight" rating for the company. Credit 
Suisse Group cut Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underperform" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 
23rd. Societe Generale cut Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Tuesday, August 6th. 
BidaskClub upgraded Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on Tuesday, October 1st. 
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Earns Daily Media Impact Rating of 1.20
Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. cut Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a research note on 
Monday, July 29th. Six research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have issued  a hold rating 
and six have issued  a buy rating to the company. The stock presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an 
average target price of $75.33. 
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

identifies negative and positive news coverage by reviewing more than 6,000 news and blog sources in real-time. 
The firm ranks coverage of public companies on a scale of negative five to positive five, with scores nearest to five 
being the most favorable.

consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%. The

EasyJet takes profit and pleasure from British Airways ' misfortune UK COMPANIES
EasyJet takes profit and pleasure from British Airways' misfortune; UK 
COMPANIES
Financial Times (London, England)
October 9, 2019 Wednesday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: COMPANIES AND MARKETS;NEWS; Pg. 18
Length: 500 words
Byline: Matthew Vincent
Body
Have you heard about Europe's new low-cost airline, Air Schadenfreude? Its flights board at departure gates right 
next to stranded British Airways passengers. Its baggage is always first on the carousel, ahead of Ryanair's 
surcharged suitcases. And its pilots will fly you to your destination and home again, unlike Thomas Cook's. Sound 
appealing? If anything, it sounds like easyJet, in its full-year trading update.
Johan Lundgren, boss of the real-life no-frills carrier, certainly took some pleasure from the misfortune of others - as 
"increased demand due to strikes at BA and Ryanair" let him increase his pre-tax profit forecast to "between £420m 
and £430m ... the upper half of our previous guidance range".
EasyJet passengers will also have taken pleasure from taking off when others couldn't, as investments in 
"operational resilience" - ie, crew rosters and standby aircraft - meant fewer cancellations since last September, 
while BA and Ryanair were leaving 235,000 people grounded.
But easyJet investors took nothing but a little pain - as a sell-off took the share price down 7.5 per cent.
Why would they have qualms over profiting at BA's and Ryanair's expense? EasyJet arguably deserved credit, and 
a slightly higher valuation, for keeping its staff onside, and in the right airports at the right time. It had them selling 
more ancillary services, too, which meant total revenue per seat rose 0.8 per cent in the second half, contrary to 
earlier guidance that it would be "slightly down". No, it wasn't the ability to profit from competitors' woes that 
investors felt uncomfortable with, just the amount of that profit.
EasyJet takes profit and pleasure from British Airways ' misfortune UK COMPANIES
Analysts at Bernstein questioned how profitable easyJet would have been without the strikes at BA and Ryanair. 
"We wonder what the influence of each of these factors, and the Thomas Cook bankruptcy, was ... the most 
interesting question to us is how much of this is due to disruption at competitors - and what the number would have 
been adjusted for underlying one-offs." In other words, how much less pleasure might easyJet have taken without 
others' misfortune? If the European airline sector is more swings and roundabouts than baggage carousels - with 
airlines taking turns to cash in on each other's disruption - then "it really amounts to a zero-sum game," argued 
analysts at AJ Bell. With plenty of investors able to play that game, easyJet's higher profit could easily have been 
anticipated. Hence the 36 per cent rise in its share price since the first BA strike was mooted, and the 7.5 per cent 
fall when there was little more positive news.
If easyJet's shares are to keep rising, and return to the FTSE 100 index, the company needs to achieve more 
progress on its own, on rising costs and slowing capacity growth. Only then will its market value rise from today's 
£4.3bn to the £4.5bn needed to overtake companies at the bottom end of the index. Its real profit will come at the 
expense of FTSE laggards Kingfisher, Centrica and J Sainsbury, not BA and Ryanair.
Load-Date: October 8, 2019
End of Document

Easyjet 's shares tumble despite 'robust' forecast
Easyjet's shares tumble despite 'robust' forecast
City A.M.
October 9, 2019 Wednesday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 City A.M. All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; TEASERS; Pg. 10
Length: 204 words
Byline: JOE CURTIS
Body
EASYJET yesterday predicted it would hit upper profit guidance of up to £430m for its full year, despite rising costs.
In a trading update, the airline said pre-tax profit would be between £420m and £430m, just off its £440m upper 
range prediction.
However, it warned of a 12 per cent rise in costs owing to a volatile pound and higher fuel prices.
Passenger numbers rose 8.6 per cent to 96m year on year thanks to a 10 per cent jump in capacity.
But revenue per seat is set for a 2.7 per cent drop due to a forex hit of £14m, despite increased demand after 
strikes by British Airways and Ryanair.
Easyjet shares slipped 4.5 per cent to 1,120p on the update and closed 7.55 per cent lower, even as analysts called 
the numbers "robust".
"Our implementation of initiatives in the fourth quarter to optimise yield has led to solid revenue performance with 
total revenue per seat at constant currency set to increase for the full year," Easyjet chief executive Johan 
Lundgren said.
CMC Markets chief market analyst Michael Hewson pointed to the 91.5 per cent load factor as a signal that 
capacity is worrying investors. "While this might improve by the end of the year it is evident that the industry still has 
too many seats," he said.
Easyjet 's shares tumble despite 'robust' forecast

Plane sailing EasyJet lifted by strikes at rival carriers
Plane sailing EasyJet lifted by strikes at rival carriers
Financial Times (London, England)
October 9, 2019 Wednesday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: COMPANIES AND MARKETS;NEWS; Pg. 18
Length: 187 words
Body
EasyJet said full-year profits would be at the top end of its forecasts, after a boost from pilot strikes at rivals British 
Airways and Ryanair.
The budget airline reported yesterday that it expected to deliver a profit before tax of between £420m and £430m 
for the 12 months ending September 30. In July, it had given a range of £400m to £440m.
The update comes almost a month after BA was hit by a two-day pilot walkout that grounded 2,325 flights.
International Airlines Group, which owns BA, warned that its full-year profits would be affected, saying the total 
financial impact of the strikes would be about (EURO)137m.
Ryanair has also seen strikes by pilots in the UK and Spain, although its flights were largely unaffected by the 
walkouts.
"EasyJet has continued to perform in line with expectations, despite challenging market conditions," said Johan 
Lundgren, chief executive.
"As a result of our self-help initiatives and the increased demand due to disruption at British Airways and Ryanair, 
we anticipate achieving headline profit before tax for the full year 2019 of between £420m and £430m." Tanya 
Powley See Lombard

(NASDAQ:RYAAY)

Oct 09, 2019( Highlight Press: http://highlightpress.com Delivered by Newstex)  Diversified Trust Co grew its 
position in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 17.4% in the third quarter, according to the company in its 
most recent 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The firm owned 47,977 shares of the 
transportation company's stock after acquiring an additional 7,115 shares during the period. Diversified Trust Co's 
holdings in Ryanair were worth $3,185,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  Other institutional investors and 
hedge funds have also recently made changes to their positions in the company. 
Metropolis Capital Ltd boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 19.6% during the 3rd quarter. Metropolis Capital 
Ltd now owns 1,310,115 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $86,965,000 after buying an additional 
214,419 shares during the period. Atria Investments LLC boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 368,237.8% 
during the 2nd quarter. Atria Investments LLC now owns 11,591,591 shares of the transportation company's stock 
worth $11,592,000 after buying an additional 11,588,444 shares during the period. Verition Fund Management LLC 
bought a new stake in shares of Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth about $1,766,000. Ladenburg Thalmann 
Financial Services Inc. boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 48.8% during the 2nd quarter. Ladenburg 
Thalmann Financial Services Inc. now owns 3,936 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $243,000 
after buying an additional 1,290 shares during the period. Finally, United Services Automobile Association boosted 
its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 57.0% during the 2nd quarter. United Services Automobile Association now 
owns 188,751 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $12,106,000 after buying an additional 68,554 
shares during the period. 49.04% of the stock is owned by institutional investors.   RYAAY[1] traded up $2.88 during 
trading on Wednesday, reaching $68.89. 2,220 shares of the company's stock were exchanged, compared to its 
average volume of 695,240. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of $55.75 and a one year high of $89.03. The 
company has a current ratio of 1.08, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79. The stock has a market 
capitalization of $14.86 billion, a PE ratio of 13.38 and a beta of 0.82. The firm has a fifty day moving average price 
of $61.56 and a two-hundred day moving average price of $66.81.    Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its 
quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company reported $1.20 EPS for the quarter, 
beating the Zacks' consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on 
equity of 18.39%. The company had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 
billion. Sell-side analysts expect that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.08 earnings per share for the current year.

European ADRs Move Lower in Tuesday Trading
European ADRs Move Lower in Tuesday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
October 8, 2019 Tuesday 10:45 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 222 words
Body
 American depositary receipts of European stocks were trading 0.84% lower at 983.12 on the BNY Mellon Europe 
Select ADR Index on Tuesday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by medical device maker Edap (EDAP) and biopharmaceutical firm 
Grifols (GRFS), which rose 1.5% and 0.9% respectively. They were followed by telecommunications company 
Ericsson (ERIC) and biopharmaceutical company MorphoSys (MOR), which were up 0.8% and 0.6%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by biopharmaceutical company DBV Technologies (DBVT) and 
semiconductor company STMicroelectronics (STM), which fell 7.7% and 3.3% respectively. They were followed by 
datng app operator Spark Networks (LOV) and biopharmaceutical firm Genfit (GNFT), which lost 3.1% and 2.2%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by biopharmaceutical company Akari Therapeutics (AKTX), which 
climbed 4.9%. It was followed by oil and gas company BP (BP) and data and analytics provider RELX Plc (RELX), 
which were up 0.7% and 0.5%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by Mereo BioPharma (MREO) and Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS), 
which fell 9.8% and 3.8% respectively. They were followed by biopharmaceutical firm Bicycle Therapeutics (BCYC) 
and airline operator Ryanair (RYAAY), which dropped 2.8% and 2.5%.

EasyJet claims benefit from BA and Ryanair strikes;  E EasyJet is expecting a full-year headline pre-tax profit of 
£420-430 million ($516-528 million), down on ....
EasyJet claims benefit from BA and Ryanair strikes;  E EasyJet is expecting 
a full-year headline pre-tax profit of £420-430 million ($516-528 million), down 
on the previous level of £578 million.
Flight International
October 8, 2019
Copyright 2019 DVV Media International Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: FLIGHTGLOBAL.COM
Length: 225 words
Body
EasyJet is expecting a full-year headline pre-tax profit of £420-430 million ($516-528 million), down on the previous 
level of £578 million.
This figure is towards the upper end of its £400-440 million estimate, disclosed in July.
The UK budget airline's chief, Johan Lundgren, says market conditions have been "challenging" but that the carrier 
has performed "in line with expectations".
EasyJet benefited slightly from strike effects at British Airways and budget rival Ryanair, although it suffered its own 
disruption during the fourth quarter, which it attributes to technical problems at London Gatwick as well as weather 
impact in Europe.
"[Our] operational resilience initiative was a key driving force behind the strong performance," says the carrier.
Revenue per seat for the full year will fall by 2.7%, at constant currency, although the airline points out that the 
figure should rise for the second half – contrary to previous expectations.
Headline cost per seat, excluding fuel, at constant currency will fall by around 0.8%. But the airline predicts a total 
fuel cost of £1.42 billion for the year.
EasyJet's first quarter bookings for 2019-20 are "in line" with levels recorded a year ago, and it expects capacity 
during the new fiscal year to be "at the lower end of our historic range".

EasyJet Forecasts Headline Profit for FY19 to Decrease to At Least $516.4 Million
EasyJet Forecasts Headline Profit for FY19 to Decrease to At Least $516.4 
Million
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
October 8, 2019 Tuesday 2:54 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 164 words
Body
 British airline easyJet (EZJ.L) said in a premarket filing Tuesday that it expects fiscal full-year headline pre-tax 
profit of between 420 million pound ($516.4 million) and 430 million pounds. 
The company previously said it expects pretax profit for the year ending Sept. 30 to be in the 400 million pounds to 
440 million pounds range. 
Both current and past estimates are lower than the 578 million headline profit before tax recorded in fiscal 2018. 
In its trading update, easyJet also said it expects total revenue per seat at constant currency for the reporting year 
to decline by 2.7%, total headline costs to jump 12% due to increased capacity, higher unit fuel costs and foreign 
exchange losses.
CEO Johan Lundgren said the company benefited from "disruption at British Airways and Ryanair," in the reporting 
period, despite challenging market conditions.   
Shares of the low-cost airline were up 3% at Monday's close.

Update: EasyJet Forecasts Headline Profit for FY19 to Decrease to At Least $516.4 Million
Update: EasyJet Forecasts Headline Profit for FY19 to Decrease to At Least 
$516.4 Million
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
October 8, 2019 Tuesday 3:33 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 172 words
Body
 British airline easyJet (EZJ.L) said in a premarket filing Tuesday that it expects fiscal full-year headline pre-tax 
profit of between 420 million pound ($516.4 million) and 430 million pounds. 
Shares of the company were down 4% at open. 
The company previously said it expects pretax profit for the year ending Sept. 30 to be in the 400 million pounds to 
440 million pounds range. 
Both current and past estimates are lower than the 578 million headline profit before tax recorded in fiscal 2018. 
In its trading update, easyJet also said it expects total revenue per seat at constant currency for the reporting year 
to decline by 2.7%, total headline costs to jump 12% due to increased capacity, higher unit fuel costs and foreign 
exchange losses.
CEO Johan Lundgren said the company benefited from "disruption at British Airways and Ryanair," in the reporting 
period, despite challenging market conditions.   
Shares of the low-cost airline were up 3% at Monday's close. 
Price (GBP): £1121.00, Change: £-51.50, Percent Change: -4.39%
Load-Date: October 12, 2019
End of Document
EasyJet Expects FY19 Headline Pretax Profit In Upper Half Of Prior Guidance
EasyJet Expects FY19 Headline Pretax Profit In Upper Half Of Prior Guidance
RTT News (United States)
October 8, 2019 Tuesday
Copyright 2019 Content Engine, LLC.
All Rights Reserved
Copyright 2019 RTT News All Rights Reserved
Length: 154 words
Byline: editorial@rttnews.com,  (RTT Staff Writer)
Body
       easyJet plc (ESYJY.PK, EZJ.L) said it has delivered a solid performance in the fourth quarter with robust 
customer demand and the delivery of self-help initiatives driving outperformance in both the passenger and ancillary 
revenue per seat. As a result of the self-help initiatives and the increased demand due to disruption at British 
Airways and Ryanair, the Group projects 2019 headline profit before tax in the upper half of its previous guidance 
range.
 For 2019, easyJet expects headline profit before tax of between 420 million pounds and 430 million pounds, in the 
upper half of the previous guidance range.
 For the fiscal year, passenger numbers increased by 8.6 percent to 96 million, driven by an increase in capacity of 
10.3 percent to 105 million seats. Load factor will decline by 1.4 percentage points to 91.5 percent. Total revenue 
per seat at constant currency will decrease by circa 2.7 percent.

Boeing shares wobble as WSJ reports potential delays in European regulatory approval for its 737 MAX planes
Boeing shares wobble as WSJ reports potential delays in European 
regulatory approval for its 737 MAX planes
Newstex Blogs 
Proactive Investors
October 8, 2019 Tuesday 5:06 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 486 words
Byline: Proactiveinvestors
Body
Oct 08, 2019( Proactive Investors: http://www.proactiveinvestors.com Delivered by Newstex)  The Boeing Company 
(NYSE:BA) saw its shares flewlower Tuesday after the company's ongoing process to get its beleaguered 737 MAX 
jets back in the air reportedly hit another snag. The Wall Street Journal reported Tuesday that disputes over how 
the MAX's dual flight-control computers will work together may prolong the vetting process, citing people familiar 
with the details. 
Shares of Boeing fell 1.8% to $369.77 in midday trading. The idea of the dual flight-control computer is to keep 
planes in the air even in the event of a chip malfunction. The disagreements could mean a lack of support from 
European regulators even after the Federal Aviation Administration gives Boeing the green light, the people said. 
READ:Ryanair boss spares no one in slam on Thomas Cook's business model, aviation authority and carbon 
emissions The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) reportedly told US regulators that it did not believe 
Boeing and the FAA had sufficiently demonstrated the safety of the computers, according to people briefed on the 
discussions, the paper added. Boeing is currently finishing tests of the computer system, the source said, and final 
results haven't yet been reported to the EASA. This could mean the European organization issues a different ruling 
than its US counterpart. The ambiguity has Boeing officials frustrated, the WSJ reported, because they remain 
unsure of what objections from EASA could further delay the process. 'We are very confident in that software 
solution, and we are now just marching through the final steps on certifying that, so that everybody's confident in 
the safety of the airplane,' CEO Dennis Mullenberg was reported as saying at a public appearance in New York last 
week. Any delay could make a huge difference, the Seattle Times has reported, as Boeing is reportedly considering 
cutting production at or temporarily shutting down its factory in Renton, Washington. For now, newly-produced MAX 
planes are heading into storage instead of in to the friendly skies. Separately, the company announced a $20 
million investment Tuesday into Virgin Galactic, the commercial spaceflight company founded by Richard Branson. 
In return, Boeing will receive new shares in Virgin Galactic, which plans to go public this year by way of a business 
combination with Social Capital Hedosophia Holdings Corp (IPOA). "Boeing's strategic investment facilitates our 
effort to drive the commercialization of space and broaden consumer access to safe, efficient, and environmentally 
responsible new forms of transportation," said Brian Schettler, senior managing director of Boeing HorizonX 
Ventures. HorizenX, which made the $20 million investment, serves as Boeing's venture capital arm. Contact 
Andrew Kessel at andrew.kessel@proactiveinvestors.com Follow him on Twitter @andrew_kessel;

Oct 08, 2019( Week Herald: https://weekherald.com Delivered by Newstex)  Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) have been assigned an average rating of "Hold" from the sixteen analysts that are currently 
covering the stock, Marketbeat.com[1] reports. Six analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have 
assigned a hold rating and six have issued a buy rating on the company. The average 12-month price objective 
among brokerages that have updated their coverage on the stock in the last year is $76.50. A number of equities 
research analysts recently commented on RYAAY shares. 
JPMorgan Chase .... lowered shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a report on 
Monday, July 29th. Bank of America started coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Monday, 
September 30th. They issued a "buy" rating on the stock. Raymond James lowered their price target on shares of 
Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" rating on the stock in a research note on Thursday, July 
11th. Credit Suisse Group lowered shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underperform" rating in a 
research note on Tuesday, July 23rd. Finally, ValuEngine[2] upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a 
"hold" rating in a research note on Wednesday, October 2nd.Several institutional investors and hedge funds have 
recently added to or reduced their stakes in RYAAY. Manchester Financial Inc. acquired a new stake in Ryanair in 
the 2nd quarter worth about $35,000. NumerixS Investment Technologies Inc bought a new position in Ryanair 
during the second quarter worth about $90,000. Westwood Holdings Group Inc. bought a new position in shares of 
Ryanair in the second quarter valued at approximately $114,000. Huntington National Bank boosted its position in 
shares of Ryanair by 21.2% in the second quarter. Huntington National Bank now owns 2,014 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $129,000 after acquiring an additional 352 shares during the period. 
Finally, Tower Research Capital LLC TRC bought a new position in shares of Ryanair in the second quarter valued 
at approximately $137,000. 49.04% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds. 
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY[3] traded up $1.73 during midday trading on Wednesday, reaching $67.93. 367,949 
shares of the company were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 696,502. Ryanair has a fifty-two week 
low of $55.75 and a fifty-two week high of $89.03. The company has a quick ratio of 1.08, a current ratio of 1.08 and 
a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79. The stock has a fifty day simple moving average of $60.87 and a two-hundred day 
simple moving average of $66.96. The firm has a market cap of $15.11 billion, a PE ratio of 13.22 and a beta of 
0.82. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 EPS for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus estimates of $1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair 
had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%. The business had revenue of $2.60 billion for the

CitySwift (formerly known as CitySwifter) launches bus scheduling technology platform with major product 
updates and funding from Ryanair co-founder
CitySwift (formerly known as CitySwifter) launches bus scheduling 
technology platform with major product updates and funding from Ryanair 
co-founder
Newstex Blogs 
Pressat
October 8, 2019 Tuesday 9:07 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 520 words
Byline: Pressat
Body
Oct 08, 2019( Pressat: http://www.pressat.co.uk Delivered by Newstex)  Tuesday 8 October, 2019 GALWAY, 
IRELAND, 8th October 2019 - CitySwifter, a leader in data-driven decision-making for bus networks, has 
announced a major update to its data science and software platform and a rebrand of its business to CitySwift.The 
CitySwift platform is used by three of the UK's big five bus companies, as well as regional bus operators and local 
authorities in the UK and across Europe. It uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to accurately predict bus 
journey times and passenger demand, ensuring on-time performance and increased passenger satisfaction.The 
new version of the platform is cloud-native and consists of two products: SwiftInsight delivers user-friendly business 
intelligence dashboards that allow bus operators to instantly visualise vast amounts of data from their network; 
identify and act on trends; predict future growth areas using big data; set custom alerts; and track KPIs such as 
operating hours, load factor and passenger count.SwiftSchedule enables bus schedulers to automatically create 
optimised timetables that take into account traffic, events and hundreds of other external factors; understand the 
impact of disruption and changes to their schedules; and model multiple future scenarios. 
To coincide with the launch, the business has rebranded and launched a new website - cityswift.com.Earlier this 
year, CitySwift completed a successful funding round led by Ryanair co-founder Declan Ryan's Irelandia 
investments.Brian, O'Rourke, CitySwift CEO comments: 'Having already optimised urban bus networks in eight of 
the UK's largest cities, this funding gives us an opportunity to help public transportation companies and authorities 
around the world make the most of their data, deliver on-time performance and increase passenger 
satisfaction.'Mike McGearty, CitySwift Chairman and former CEO of CarTrawler, comments: 'CitySwift has the 
potential to be one of the next big success stories on the Irish tech scene. They already have an impressive list of 
major UK clients and advantageous changing market trends on their side.'Bus industry veteran and former MD of 
Stagecoach UK Bus, Robert Montgomery, agrees. 'The data insights created by Cityswift can deliver lower costs 
and happier passengers. Knowing you can offer enhanced reliability and greater passenger satisfaction at less cost 
through a better understanding of data opens up a whole new future for urban buses.'About CitySwiftCitySwift 
makes bus routes more efficient. The CitySwift platform uses AI and machine learning to accurately predict journey 
times and passenger demand, creating optimised timetables that take into account traffic, events and hundreds of 
CitySwift (formerly known as CitySwifter) launches bus scheduling technology platform with major product 
updates and funding from Ryanair co-founder
other external factors, ensuring on-time performance and increased passenger satisfaction. Customisable 
management dashboards deliver business intelligence and enable tracking of KPIs.  * For more information

European ADRs Move Higher in Monday Trading
European ADRs Move Higher in Monday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
October 7, 2019 Monday 10:30 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 235 words
Body
 American depositary receipts of European stocks were trading 0.35% higher at 994.52 on the BNY Mellon Europe 
Select ADR Index on Monday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by dating app operator Spark Networks (LOV) and telecommunications 
company Ericsson (ERIC), which rose 3.7% and 2.5% respectively. They were followed by medical device maker 
Edap (EDAP) and telecommunications operator Orange (ORAN), which were up 2.3% and 1.4% respectively.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by biopharmaceutical company DBV Technologies (DBVT) and 
biotech firm Zealand Pharma (ZEAL), which lost 8% and 5.8% respectively. They were followed by 
biopharmaceutical firm Genfit (GNFT)  and 3D printer maker voxeljet (VJET), which shed 4.4% and 2%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by biopharmaceutical company Akari Therapeutics (AKTX) and 
telecommunications operator Vodafone Group (VOD), which rose 3.7% and 1.6% respectively. They were followed 
by airline operator Ryanair (RYAAY) and medical device maker Smith & Nephew (SNN), which were up 1.1% and 
0.5%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by specialty pharmaceutical firm Motif Bio (MTFB), which lost 10.4%, 
followed by pharmaceutical company Avadel (AVDL), biopharmaceutical company NuCana (NCNA), and airplane 
lessor Fly Leasing (FLY), which were off 4.6%, 3.7%, and 3.6% respectively.
Price: 2.03, Change: +0.11, Percent Change: +5.68

Vienna airport expects LCC consolidation Vienna International airport has seen a boom in low-cost carriers 
after the collapse of Air Berlin and its local unit N....
Vienna airport expects LCC consolidation; Vienna International airport has 
seen a boom in low-cost carriers after the collapse of Air Berlin and its local 
unit Niki in 2017, but its chief operating officer expects that some form of 
consolidation will occur soon.
Flight International
October 7, 2019
Copyright 2019 DVV Media International Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: FLIGHTGLOBAL.COM
Length: 313 words
Body
Vienna International airport has seen a boom in low-cost carriers after the collapse of Air Berlin and its local unit 
Niki in 2017, but its chief operating officer expects that some form of consolidation will occur soon.
The Austrian capital has become a hotbed of LCC competition, with the emergence of Ryanair's Lauda and IAG's 
Level. Wizz Air, meanwhile, has signalled that it intends to grow its Vienna base to15-20 aircraft within the next five 
years.
The airport's chief operating officer Julian Jager says that after the loss of Air Berlin, "a lot of low cost carriers 
discovered Vienna as a potential market and they are fighting now for the number two position" next to Austrian 
Airlines.
But he expects that there will be some rationalisation in the boom of low-cost capacity in the near-term.
"I would not be surprised if we see a certain consolidation – maybe next year, maybe the year after. I think that's 
normal with growth like that," he says.
As is, the situation appears unsustainable with the newer players discounting fares to build up their market share.
"We are seeing right now ticket price levels which are not sustainable," observes Jager. "I think it's obvious now that 
everyone went into the market, they have to position themselves and gain market share, but it is not sustainable in 
the long run. That is why there will be, one way or the other, consolidation and this does not bother us."
While the low-cost boom has helped to deliver passenger growth, Vienna has also benefited from the expansion of 
Austrian and the wider Lufthansa Group, as well as strong inbound tourism from Asia.
Vienna airport expects LCC consolidation Vienna International airport has seen a boom in low-cost carriers 
after the collapse of Air Berlin and its local unit N....
"Overall I think this is a reflection that Vienna is becoming a more and more attractive market. I think it is an 
attractive incoming tourism market, and at the same time the Austrian economy is doing well, and therefore it is a 
strong outgoing market as well," says Jager.

covering the stock, Marketbeat Ratings[1] reports. Six research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, 
three have given a hold rating and six have given a buy rating to the company. The average twelve-month price 
objective among brokerages that have issued a report on the stock in the last year is $76.50. A number of equities 
research analysts have recently issued reports on the stock.
