Ryanair logo Atria Investments LLC increased its holdings in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 
368,237.8% during the 2nd quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission (SEC). The fund owned 11,591,591 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an 
additional 11,588,444 shares during the quarter. Atria Investments LLC owned approximately 4.95% of Ryanair 
worth $11,592,000 as of its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).  
Other hedge funds and other institutional investors have also bought and sold shares of the company. Manchester 
Financial Inc. bought a new stake in shares of  Ryanair in the second quarter worth about $35,000.  NumerixS 
Investment Technologies Inc purchased a new stake in  Ryanair in the second quarter worth about $90,000.  
Westwood Holdings Group Inc. purchased a new stake in  Ryanair in the second quarter worth about $114,000.  
Huntington National Bank lifted its holdings in  Ryanair by 21.2% in the second quarter. Huntington National Bank 
now owns 2,014 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $129,000 after buying an additional 352 shares 
during the period.  Finally, Tower Research Capital LLC TRC purchased a new stake in  Ryanair in the second 
quarter worth about $137,000. 49.04% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors.  
Several analysts have commented on RYAAY shares. BidaskClub upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating 
to a "hold" rating in a report on Saturday, September 21st. Canaccord Genuity lowered shares of Ryanair from a 
"buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Wednesday, June 5th. Bank of America started coverage on shares of 
Ryanair in a report on Monday. They issued a "buy" rating for the company. Societe Generale lowered shares of 
Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, August 6th. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. 
lowered shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a report on Monday, July 29th. 
Seven equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have issued  a hold rating and five 
have given a buy rating to the stock. Ryanair presently has an average rating of "Hold" and a consensus target 
price of $75.33. 
Shares of RYAAY  opened at $66.38 on Tuesday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a current ratio of 
1.08 and a quick ratio of 1.08. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of $55.75 and a one year high of $89.03. 
The company has a 50-day simple moving average of $60.39 and a two-hundred day simple moving average of 
$67.16. The firm has a market capitalization of $14.77 billion, a PE ratio of 12.91 and a beta of 0.79.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 EPS for the quarter, topping the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06.

Ryanair had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%. The business had revenue of $2.60 billion 
during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 billion.  Analysts expect that  Ryanair Holdings plc will 
post 4.07 EPS for the current fiscal year.  
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

E Ryanair 'reasonably confident' of 737 Max return by early 2020 Ryanair group chief executive Michael 
O'Leary is "reasonably confident" that the Boeing 737 Max....
 E Ryanair 'reasonably confident' of 737 Max return by early 2020; Ryanair 
group chief executive Michael O'Leary is "reasonably confident" that the 
Boeing 737 Max will return to service in Europe "either this side of 
Christmas or maybe the far side of Christmas".
Flight International
October 1, 2019
Copyright 2019 DVV Media International Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: FLIGHTGLOBAL.COM
Length: 467 words
Body
Ryanair group chief executive Michael O'Leary is frustrated that the Boeing 737 Max grounding is slowing the 
operator's capacity growth, but is "reasonably confident" that the aircraft will return to service in Europe by early 
2020.
The situation "will slow down our growth into summer 2020", O'Leary states during a Reuters Newsmakers 
discussion forum on 1 October, adding that "when an opportunity comes up like the failure of Thomas Cook... we 
want to be able to grow faster, not slower".
He adds that there could be further base cuts and job losses at the Irish carrier, if its expectation that the Max will 
be cleared to fly again "either this side of Christmas or maybe the far side of Christmas" proves too optimistic.
Those cuts would come despite Ryanair's moves to delay the exit of some 737NGs from its fleet to partially offset 
the lack of Max deliveries.
He notes, however, that amid his frustration over the Max situation, "safety is our main priority".
Reiterating earlier estimates that Ryanair would only be able to take about half of its Max backlog by the 2020 
summer season, O'Leary explains that at maximum capacity, the airline can receive eight new aircraft per month.
APA-PictureDesk GmbH/Shutterstock
"If it's back flying by January/February... we could take maybe 30/40 aircraft for next year, but we won't be able to 
take all 60," he states, referring to the backlog of Max deliveries the carrier would have accrued by the 2020 
summer season.
E Ryanair 'reasonably confident' of 737 Max return by early 2020 Ryanair group chief executive Michael 
O'Leary is "reasonably confident" that the Boeing 737 Max....
"If it's slightly later than that, it could come down to 30. Most of our planning at the moment is based on 30 Max 
aircraft for next year."
Any further delay will mean "we have to look again at our summer 2020 capacity. That might involve more cuts and 
some more job losses," O'Leary says.
In early August, the Ryanair chief had already stated that "we will need about 600 less pilots and cabin crew for 
summer 2020" based on the assumption that the operator would receive around 30 Max jets during 2020.
Ryanair is taking steps to mitigate the impact of the Max grounding, O'Leary says, stating that "about 15 of our 
aircraft shortage next summer will be made up by postponing aircraft sales and extending leases".
He cites a deal reach with lessor GECAS, under which Ryanair will keep seven of 10 "older 737NGs" that the 
operator had originally intended to sell this winter.
"We're also extending some of the aircraft that are coming off lease at the moment," he says, adding: "I think it's 
seven or eight aircraft – we're extending leases for another 12 months."
Ryanair had been due to receive its first 737 Max 8 in April 2019, but Boeing suspended deliveries in March in the 
wake of the jets' global grounding.
Cirium fleets data shows that Ryanair has 423 737NGs in service. It has 135 Max 8s on firm order and holds 
options on a further 75.
Load-Date: October 30, 2019
End of Document
Ryanair in talks with lessors to introduce ex-Thomas Cook A320s Ryanair is negotiating with leasing 
companies affected by Thomas Cook's demise to take over seve....
Ryanair in talks with lessors to introduce ex-Thomas Cook A320s; Ryanair is 
negotiating with leasing companies affected by Thomas Cook's demise to 
take over several Airbus jets for use by its Austrian subsidiary Lauda.
Flight International
October 1, 2019
Copyright 2019 DVV Media International Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: FLIGHTGLOBAL.COM
Length: 264 words
Body
Ryanair is negotiating with leasing companies affected by Thomas Cook's demise to take over several Airbus jets 
for use by its Austrian subsidiary Lauda.
Speaking at a briefing hosted by Thomson Reuters in London today, Ryanair chief executive Michael O'Leary said 
the plan was to boost Lauda's fleet for the summer 2020 schedule.
The number of aircraft would depend on asset pricing and company's capacity to recruit and train pilots ahead of 
the summer season, he says.
Lauda's fleet comprises 21 Airbus A320ceos, a mixture of CFM International CFM56- and International Aero 
Engines V2500-powered aircraft, Cirium fleets data shows.
Beyond Thomas Cook's fleet, O'Leary sees opportunity to increase the Ryanair group's A320 fleet with second-
hand aircraft.
He says "lots of leasing companies are taking back 8-10-year-old Ceos" as airlines introduce A320neos.
Ryanair is in talks with both Boeing and Airbus about possible future aircraft orders for delivery beyond its existing 
fleet plan, which runs until 2024. But O'Leary concedes that discussions with Airbus are "not going very fast".
He currently sees "no pricing opportunity" with either airframer as Boeing concentrates on returning the 737 Max to 
service while Airbus ramps up production to deliver its A320neo backlog.
As "pricing is up" at both airframers, he says that Ryanair will "have to wait until the next turn of the cycle".
Cirium fleets data shows that Ryanair, its UK division, its Polish subsidiary Buzz, and Malta Air together have 456 
737NGs in service.
Ryanair in talks with lessors to introduce ex-Thomas Cook A320s Ryanair is negotiating with leasing 
companies affected by Thomas Cook's demise to take over seve....
The group has 135 Max 8s on order and holds options on a further 75.
Load-Date: October 30, 2019
End of Document
Ryanair seeks ex-Thomas Cook aircraft for Lauda
Ryanair seeks ex-Thomas Cook aircraft for Lauda
AirFinance Journal
October 2019
Copyright 2019 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 305 words
Byline: Oliver Clark
Body
Ryanair is in talks with a number of leasing companies about the prospect of transferring their aircraft from Thomas 
Cook to Lauda.
Speaking at a media event in London on 1 October, Ryanair group chief executive Michael O'Leary said that the 
airline group was holding talks with undisclosed lessors about deploying former Thomas Cook aircraft with its 
Austrian subsidiary for the summer 2020 season.
Thomas Cook Group filed for insolvency on 23 September. While some parts of the group's former European 
business continue to operate, Thomas Cook Airlines UK has been grounded.
Airfinance Journal's Fleet Tracker shows that the airline has a fleet of 39 aircraft, consisting of three Airbus A320s, 
28 A321s and eight A330s.
The majority of these are leased. Of Thomas Cook's lessors, Aviation Capital Group is most exposed, with nine 
aircraft placed with the defunct leisure carrier, while five were placed by Air Lease and four by ICBC Leasing. 
O'Leary did not specify how far these talks had progressed.
Ryanair took an almost 25% stake in Lauda in March 2018 and went on to acquire the remaining 75% from owner 
Niki Lauda in August of that year. The carrier operates a fleet of leased A320s.
O'Leary said that over the past 12 months Ryanair had discerned a "sweet spot" for A320 lease rates.
He believes this was the result of Airbus having been "so successful" with sales of the A320neo, leading to the 
return of used current-generation aircraft between eight and 10 years old on fuel efficiency grounds.
When Ryanair took over Lauda it was operating A320s leased from Lufthansa, which O'Leary claimed was charging 
the Vienna-based airline $400,000 per month per aircraft.
Ryanair has since managed to replace these aircraft with 22 A320s from other lessors at an average monthly lease 
rental cost of under $200,000 per month, O'Leary said.
Ryanair seeks ex-Thomas Cook aircraft for Lauda
Load-Date: October 21, 2019
End of Document
Ryanair extends 737NG leases over Max grounding
Ryanair extends 737NG leases over Max grounding
AirFinance Journal
October 2019
Copyright 2019 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 505 words
Byline: Oliver Clark
Body
Ryanair is slowing down its aircraft phase-outs and extending existing lease terms in response to the grounding of 
the Boeing 737 Max, Ryanair Group chief executive officer Michael O'Leary has disclosed.
Speaking at a media briefing in London on 1 October, O'Leary said that as a result of the grounding the low-cost 
carrier (LCC) would retain the services for the summer 2020 period of seven of 10 737NGs it has sold to GECAS. 
These aircraft will now be delivered to the lessor in the winter of 2020.
The lease agreements on a further seven or eight 737s are also being extended by another 12 months. O'Leary 
said this would give the Irish carrier extra capacity from approximately 15 "short" aircraft next summer.
He estimates that the 737 Max could be recertified and back in service in North America "this side of Christmas", 
and could return to European skies "this side of Christmas or the other side of Christmas".
He said he was "reasonably confident" that the Max would be back flying for Ryanair during the summer of 2020.
Ryanair is working to an assumption that it will take delivery of 30 737 Max aircraft in 2020, of a backlog of 60 of the 
type.
The airline can take a maximum of eight new aircraft a month, he added.
"We are in continuous dialogue with Boeing. If it's back flying by January, February, March next year we could 
maybe take delivery of 30 or 40 next year, but it won't be 60," he said.
The Max grounding also means Ryanair cannot take advantage of the collapse of rivals such as Thomas Cook, 
which filed for insolvency earlier this month, because it is growing more slowly than expected.
While Ryanair is talking to Boeing about compensation for the disruption caused by the grounding, O'Leary said 
such negotiations could not be concluded until the aircraft had returned to commercial service.
He added that Ryanair is in talks with both Boeing and Airbus about the prospect of "new aircraft" orders.
The airline already has 200 aircraft on order which would be "more than enough" to take it through to 2024, he said.
Ryanair extends 737NG leases over Max grounding
Instead, discussions are focused on opportunities for new aircraft to be delivered in 2023, 2024 and 2025.
O'Leary said that both Boeing and Airbus are "pricing up" at the moment which mean there are"no pricing 
opportunities" for the LCC to exploit.
"I think we will have to wait until the next of the turn of the cycle and there will be another turn of the aircraft cycle 
between now and 2024," he said.
O'Leary said Ryanair would reach a "capex peak" in 2020 in the region of (EURO)2.2 billion, most of which would 
be "internally generated".
As a result, it is "unlikely" the airline would initiate a share buyback programme next year, he added.
O'Leary said Ryanair had no plans to issue a bond in 2020 and would in fact seek to pay down existing debt.
He said the airline has $300 million to $400 million of US Ex-Im bank debt with a coupon of 2-3%, which once 
seemed like "the cheapest money in history [but] now it's the most expensive debt we have, so we will be paying 
down that debt next year".
Load-Date: October 21, 2019
End of Document
Easyjet full-year profit to be in "~upper half' of guidance
Easyjet full-year profit to be in "~upper half' of guidance
AirFinance Journal
October 2019
Copyright 2019 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 300 words
Byline: Oliver Clark
Body
Easyjet expects to deliver a full-year pre-tax profit in the "upper half" of its previous guidance after a fourth quarter 
in which it reaped the benefits of operational efficiencies and strike action at rivals Ryanair and British Airways.
The UK carrier forecasts a profit of between £420 million and £430 million ($508 million to $520 million) for the year 
after a quarter ending 30 September which was characterised by "yield optimisation self-help initiatives" and 
"increased demand" due to industrial action impacting rivals.
The carrier said its operational resilience programmes had helped it to offset a "difficult disruption environment", 
which included the impact of storms across Europe and technical issues at Gatwick airport.
Passenger numbers for the full year should increase by 8.6% to 96 million, driven by an increase in capacity of 
10.3% to 105 million seats. Load factor for the full-year will decrease by 1.4 percentage points to 91.5%.
Total revenue per seat at constant currency for the full year will decrease by circa 2.7% and total headline cost will 
increase by circa 12% due to "increased capacity, higher unit fuel costs and adverse foreign exchange 
movements". This increase was partially offset by improvements in cost per seat ex fuel, Easyjet said.
Total fuel costs are expected to be around £1.42 billion, which includes an adverse impact of foreign exchange and 
increased European emissions trading system costs.
Total headline foreign exchange will have a year-on-year adverse impact of around £14 million.
The Luton-based carrier said it will publish its full-year results in November.
First quarter 2020 forward bookings are currently "in line" with the same time last year. Easyjet's expects capacity 
growth for full-year 2020 to be at the lower end of its historic range.
Load-Date: October 28, 2019
End of Document

Newstex Blogs

Brexit to have no long-term impact on Ryanair says O'Leary
Brexit to have no long-term impact on Ryanair says O'Leary
Business World (Digest)
October 01, 2019 Tuesday
Copyright 2019 Media World Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: WORLD
Length: 128 words
Byline: Business World
Body
Britain's decision to leave the European Union will have no long-term impact on Ryanair, Chief Executive Michael 
O'Leary said on Tuesday, adding that the UK would need an EU trade deal and it was unrealistic to think otherwise.
"If you look out long enough, I don't think Brexit has any affect on our business," O'Leary said at a Reuters 
Newsmaker event in London, adding that he thought Britain and the EU would reach a trade deal and retain the 
Open Skies aviation agreement.
"The UK's national interest is best served, I think, by staying in the European Union. It's nuts to leave it, but if you 
are going to leave, the first thing you've got to do on the day after you leave is renegotiate a trade deal with the 
European Union." (Reuters)
Source: www.businessworld.ie

Ryanair ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Earns Buy Rating from Analysts at Bank of America
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Earns Buy Rating from Analysts at Bank of 
America
American Banking and Market News
September 30, 2019 Monday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 727 words
Body
Ryanair logo Research analysts at            Bank of America  initiated coverage on shares of Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) in a report issued on Monday,            The Fly  reports. The firm set a "buy" rating on the 
transportation company's stock. 
A number of other research firms have also commented on RYAAY. Credit Suisse Group lowered Ryanair from a 
"neutral" rating to an "underperform" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 23rd. Canaccord Genuity lowered 
Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Wednesday, June 5th. Morgan Stanley began 
coverage on Ryanair in a research note on Wednesday, September 18th. They set an "underweight" rating on the 
stock. Deutsche Bank upgraded Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on Friday, June 
7th. Finally, Societe Generale lowered Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Tuesday, 
August 6th. Seven investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have assigned  a hold rating 
and five have assigned  a buy rating to the company's stock. The company  has a consensus rating of "Hold" and 
an average price target of $75.33. 
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  traded up $0.90 on Monday, reaching $66.31. The company had a trading volume of 
12,718 shares, compared to its average volume of 544,942. The company has a quick ratio of 1.08, a current ratio 
of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79. The stock has a 50-day moving average price of $60.07 and a 200 day 
moving average price of $67.28. The stock has a market capitalization of $14.77 billion, a P/E ratio of 12.92 and a 
beta of 0.79. Ryanair has a twelve month low of $55.75 and a twelve month high of $97.19.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 EPS for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus estimates of $1.14 by $0.06. The 
business had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 billion. Ryanair had a 
return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%.  On average, sell-side analysts predict that  Ryanair will 
post 4.07 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
Several hedge funds have recently added to or reduced their stakes in RYAAY. New York State Common 
Retirement Fund grew its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 5.2% in the 1st quarter. New York State Common 
Retirement Fund now owns 110,875 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $8,309,000 after 
purchasing an additional 5,470 shares during the period.  Parametric Portfolio Associates LLC grew its stake in 
shares of  Ryanair by 7.0% in the 1st quarter. Parametric Portfolio Associates LLC now owns 156,468 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $11,726,000 after purchasing an additional 10,230 shares during the 
Ryanair ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Earns Buy Rating from Analysts at Bank of America
period.  Envestnet Asset Management Inc. grew its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 27.2% in the 1st quarter. 
Envestnet Asset Management Inc. now owns 126,609 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$9,488,000 after purchasing an additional 27,086 shares during the period.  Northwestern Mutual Investment 
Management Company LLC grew its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 26.4% in the 1st quarter. Northwestern Mutual 
Investment Management Company LLC now owns 14,690 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$1,101,000 after purchasing an additional 3,072 shares during the period.  Finally, Galibier Capital Management 
Ltd. grew its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 12.3% in the 1st quarter. Galibier Capital Management Ltd. now owns 
27,397 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $2,053,000 after purchasing an additional 3,010 
shares during the period. Institutional investors own  49.04% of the company's stock.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

500 Spain Hotels 'To Close Immediately' After Thomas Cook Fall: Industry
500 Spain Hotels 'To Close Immediately' After Thomas Cook Fall: Industry
Newstex Blogs 
International Business Times News
September 30, 2019 Monday 12:46 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 380 words
Body
Sep 30, 2019( International Business Times News: http://www.ibtimes.com Delivered by Newstex)  Hundreds of 
hotels in Spain are facing imminent closure over the collapse of British travel giant Thomas Cook, the head of the 
Spanish hotel federation warned on Monday."There are 500 hotels which are going to close immediately due to the 
collapse of Thomas Cook and the situation could get worse if the government doesn't take immediate action," Juan 
Molas, head of Spain's Confederation of Hotels and Tourist Accommodation, told business daily Cinco Dias.And the 
sum in unpaid bills left by the demise of the tour operator would be much higher than the initial estimate of 200 
million euros ($220 million), said Molas, whose organisation represents 15,000 businesses."It will be much more. 
The amount for only eight chains is close to 100 million." 
Of those hotels facing immediate closure, 100 were exclusively dependent on Thomas Cook, he said, while the rest 
counted on the firm for between 30 and 70 percent of their clients.One hotel in Fuerteventura, the second largest of 
the Canary Islands, had recently undergone a 20-million-euro upgrade and was now faced with 700 rooms "which 
are going to be empty from October 7" and 200 employees it would be forced to dismiss.Worst hit are those in the 
Canaries and the Balearic Islands, where 40 percent of hotels are affected.The industry has put together an 
emergency plan to be presented to Tourism Minister Reyes Maroto at the next Spanish tourism board meeting on 
October 7 which will also address the urgent question of air links with the Canary Islands.Industry experts fear the 
impact there could be even more devastating than elsewhere as the resort is very popular as a winter destination 
among tourists from northern Europe."The busy season is starting and Thomas Cook had 30 percent of air 
capacity," Molas said, indicating the disappearance of the package holidaymaker could affect some 1.3 million 
airline seats, with Tenerife and Lanzarote particularly badly hit.He urged the government to contact RyanAir, one of 
the few carriers that flies there, to urge the budget airline "to reconsider" plans to close four bases in Spain, three of 
them in the Canaries, saying it was "critical" that the airline maintain its flights. 
Load-Date: September 30, 2019
End of Document
Ryanair prefers fuel tax to ETS or national taxes
Ryanair prefers fuel tax to ETS or national taxes
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
September 30, 2019
Copyright 2019 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 195 words
Body
A fuel tax would be more effective at cutting aviation's carbon emissions than the European Union's Emissions 
Trading Scheme (ETS) and the array of national environmental taxes currently emerging across Europe, Kenny 
Jacobs, chief marketing officer at Ryanair (FR, Dublin Int'l), has told Aviation International News. The combination 
of the ETS and the new national taxes will distort competition as they protect legacy carriers and large hubs instead 
of reducing carbon emissions, he argued.

the globe with Frequent Flyer Destinations Magazine, AirGuideOnline, AirGuide Destination Travel Guides, 
AirGuideBusiness. Editorial eMail: edit@AirGuideOnline.com

America
Newstex Blogs 
Highlight Press
September 30, 2019 Monday 7:21 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 824 words
Byline: Eric Schroeder
Body
Sep 30, 2019( Highlight Press: http://highlightpress.com Delivered by Newstex)  Bank of America[1] initiated 
coverage on shares of Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) in a research note issued to investors on Monday, The Fly[2] 
reports. The brokerage set a 'buy' rating on the transportation company's stock. Several other brokerages have also 
issued reports on RYAAY. 
BidaskClub raised Ryanair from a 'sell' rating to a 'hold' rating in a research report on Saturday, September 21st. 
Societe Generale lowered Ryanair from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a research report on Tuesday, August 6th. 
Morgan Stanley started coverage on Ryanair in a research report on Wednesday, September 18th. They set an 
'underweight' rating on the stock. Raymond James reduced their target price on Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and 
set an 'outperform' rating on the stock in a research report on Thursday, July 11th. Finally, Credit Suisse Group 
lowered Ryanair from a 'neutral' rating to an 'underperform' rating in a research report on Tuesday, July 23rd. 
Seven equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have assigned a hold rating and five 
have assigned a buy rating to the stock. Ryanair has a consensus rating of 'Hold' and an average target price of 
$75.33.  NASDAQ:RYAAY[3] traded up $0.97 during mid-day trading on Monday, hitting $66.38. 12,331 shares of 
the company's stock traded hands, compared to its average volume of 544,942. The company has a fifty day 
moving average of $60.07 and a 200 day moving average of $67.28. Ryanair has a twelve month low of $55.75 and 
a twelve month high of $97.19. The company has a market capitalization of $14.77 billion, a P/E ratio of 12.91 and 
a beta of 0.79. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a current ratio of 1.08.    
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company 
reported $1.20 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of 
$1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%. The company had revenue 
of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 billion. On average, research analysts 
expect that Ryanair will post 4.07 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  A number of institutional investors

Ryanair Launches Summer 2020 Schedule
Ryanair Launches Summer 2020 Schedule
Newstex Blogs 
FFT.ie
September 30, 2019 Monday 3:07 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 455 words
Byline: Mark Murphy
Body
Sep 30, 2019( FFT.ie: http://www.fft.ie Delivered by Newstex)             https://www.fft.ie/ryanair-launches-summer-
2020-schedule/28688#            https://www.fft.ie/ryanair-launches-summer-2020-schedule/28688# 
denied:whatsapp://send?text=Ryanair%20Launches%20Summer%202020%20Schedule%20 
 
 
 
 
 
     
https://www.fft.ie/ryanair-launches-summer-2020-schedule/28688            https://www.fft.ie/ryanair-launches-
summer-2020-schedule/28688# 
mailto:?subject=Ryanair%20Launches%20Summer%202020%20Schedule...Y=I%20found%20this%20article%20in
teresting%20and%20thought%20of%20sharing%20it%20with%20you.%20Check%20it%20out:%20 
 
 
 
 
 
     
https://www.fft.ie/ryanair-launches-summer-2020-schedule/28688            https://www.fft.ie/ryanair-launches-
summer-2020-schedule/28688#respond Ryanair has launched its summer 2020 schedule, including four new 
Dublin routes as well as three new summer services from Cork. 
From summer 2020, Ryanair will operate 105 routes in total from Dublin, including new routes to Marseille (5 per 
week), Palanga (3 per week), Podgorica (2 per week) ...rona (3 per week). Additional flights have been added to 
existing routes to Bristol (3 daily), Bydgoszcz (3), Riga (daily) ...lnius (4). From Cork airport, Ryanair will operate a 
new summer 2020 service to Katowice, Poland. The twice-weekly service is an extension of the brand-new winter 
schedule route, commencing in October. The airline has also announced an expansion of flights on two other 
summer services from Cork Airport to Malaga, now six per week, and Palma, now four per week. Ryanair now 
serves 23 routes in total from Cork Airport. Ryanair's passenger numbers at Cork Airport are forecast to rise by 
23% in 2019, the largest increase among all Irish airports. Cork airport's Managing Director, Niall MacCarthy, said: 
'The brand-new Katowice route is set to kick off in October and we are delighted that it will now also be included in 
the 2020 summer schedule. With the added flights to Ryanair's Malaga and Palma summer routes, Cork Airport is 
in a firm position to continue its strong growth trajectory.' Ryanair's Kenny Jacobs said: 'Our Summer schedule 
2020, with four new Dublin routes to Marseille, Palanga, Podgorica and Verona, and 160 routes in total, which will 
deliver 17.2m customers p.a. and support over 12,900 jobs at Dublin, Shannon, Cork, Knock and Kerry airports.' 
Niall Gibbons, CEO of Tourism Ireland, said: 'Against the current economic backdrop, we welcome the fact that 
Ryanair capacity for 2020 will be up by 1%. Most of the routes which are important for Irish tourism will be retained 
and we look forward to co-operating with Ryanair to maximise the promotion of its new flights from Marseilles and 
Verona to Dublin Airport.' 
Ryanair Launches Summer 2020 Schedule

Royal Bank of Canada Reduces Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Royal Bank of Canada Reduces Position in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
September 29, 2019 Sunday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 699 words
Body
Ryanair logo Royal Bank of Canada lessened its stake in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 
4.8% in the second quarter, according to the company in its most recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The firm 
owned 1,352,188 shares of the transportation company's stock after selling 68,029 shares during the quarter. Royal 
Bank of Canada owned approximately 0.58% of Ryanair worth $86,730,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  
Other large investors also recently added to or reduced their stakes in the company. Manchester Financial Inc. 
bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair during the second quarter valued at approximately $35,000.  NumerixS 
Investment Technologies Inc bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair during the second quarter valued at 
approximately $90,000.  Westwood Holdings Group Inc. bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair during the 
second quarter valued at approximately $114,000.  Huntington National Bank raised its holdings in shares of  
Ryanair by 21.2% during the second quarter. Huntington National Bank now owns 2,014 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $129,000 after acquiring an additional 352 shares in the last quarter.  
Finally, Tower Research Capital LLC TRC bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair during the second quarter 
valued at approximately $137,000. 47.13% of the stock is owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors.  
RYAAY  traded up $0.16 during trading on Friday, reaching $65.41. The stock had a trading volume of 348,500 
shares, compared to its average volume of 544,942. The stock's 50 day moving average is $60.07 and its two-
hundred day moving average is $67.28. The company has a current ratio of 1.08, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a debt-
to-equity ratio of 0.79. The company has a market capitalization of $14.69 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 12.73 
and a beta of 0.79. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of $55.75 and a one year high of $97.19.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus estimates of $1.14 
by $0.06. The business had revenue of $2.60 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of 
$2.60 billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%.  On average, equities research 
analysts predict that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.07 earnings per share for the current year.  
A number of equities analysts recently commented on RYAAY shares. Societe Generale downgraded Ryanair from 
a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, August 6th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. downgraded Ryanair 
from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a report on Monday, July 29th. BidaskClub upgraded Ryanair 
from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Saturday, September 21st. Morgan Stanley began coverage on 
Ryanair in a report on Wednesday, September 18th. They issued an "underweight" rating for the company. Finally, 
Royal Bank of Canada Reduces Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Canaccord Genuity downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Wednesday, June 5th. 
Seven analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have assigned  a hold rating and four have issued  a 
buy rating to the company's stock. The company presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average price 
target of $75.33. 
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

shares. Based on an average trading volume of 558,700 shares, the days-to-cover ratio is presently 1.3 days.

A vital Boeing 737 Next Gen part that attaches the plane's body to its wings is having a 'cracking issue' (BA)
A vital Boeing 737 Next Gen part that attaches the plane's body to its wings 
is having a 'cracking issue' (BA)
Newstex Blogs 
The Business Insider
September 29, 2019 Sunday 3:55 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 675 words
Byline: Ashley Rodriguez
Body
Sep 29, 2019( The Business Insider: http://www.businessinsider.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Reuters/Sergei 
Karpukhin Aircraft manufacturer Boeing has discovered cracks in a vital part of its Boeing 737 Next Generation 
planes that connects the body of the aircraft to its wings, CNN affiliate KOMO first reported[1]. Boeing discovered 
the "cracking issue" in a small number of planes, the company said in a statement. The Federal Aviation 
Administration has ordered operators to inspect the planes for structural cracks. Boeing's website lists more than 
100 airlines as customers of 737 NG planes. 
The 737 Max, which was grounded in March after two fatal plane crashes, is not affected by this issue. Visit 
Business Insider's homepage for more stories.[2] Aircraft manufacturer Boeing has discovered a "cracking issue" in 
a vital part of its Boeing 737 Next Generation planes that connects the body of the aircraft to its wings, Charlie 
Harger at CNN affiliate KOMO first reported[3]. The aircraft piece in question, known as a "pickle fork," helps 
connect the plane's body to its wings. Pickle forks are designed to last the life of the plane, which is usually around 
90,000 or more take offs and landings the publication reported. But, in one instance, Boeing found cracked pickle 
forks in a plane that had logged about 35,000 take offs and landings, according to KOMO. The Federal Aviation 
Administration has ordered operators of 737 NG planes to inspect the aircraft for structural cracks, according to a 
statement shared with Business Insider. Boeing reported the issue to the FAA after it discovered the cracks while 
modifying a "heavily used aircraft," according to the statement. The company found similar cracks in a small 
number of other planes, as well. Boeing said in a statement it has notified operators of the issue, and that the 
planes with cracks are "undergoing modifications." No in-service issues have been reported, the company said. 
Boeing's website lists more than 100 airlines as 737 NG customers, including American Airlines, Delta Airlines, 
EgyptAir, RyanAir, and Southwest Airlines. The 737 NG models include 737-700, 7370-800, and 737-900 aircraft. 
The 737 Max is not affected by the cracking issue, the company said. That model was grounded in March after two 
fatal plane crashes. Read more: The complete history of the 737 Max, Boeing's promising yet problematic 
workhorse jet[4]NOW WATCH: Amazon is reportedly seeking a new space in New York City. Here's why the giant 
canceled its HQ2 plans 5 months ago.[5]See Also: On day 3 of worlds, Nigerian sprinters appeal to run[6]Russians 
set to rally to demand release of jailed protesters[7]Canadian tourist dies in paragliding accident in Tanzania's 
Mount 
Kilimanjaro[8]

boeing-737ng-equipment

Bank of America Corp DE Has $37.98 Million Stock Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Bank of America Corp DE Has $37.98 Million Stock Holdings in Ryanair 
Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
September 28, 2019 Saturday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 692 words
Body
Ryanair logo Bank of America Corp DE grew its position in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 3.7% 
during the 2nd quarter, according to its most recent 13F filing with the SEC. The institutional investor  owned 
592,134 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 21,313 shares during the 
period. Bank of America Corp DE owned about 0.25% of Ryanair worth $37,980,000 as of its most recent filing with 
the SEC.  
Several other large investors have also recently modified their holdings of the company. Manchester Financial Inc. 
acquired a new position in  Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth about $35,000.  NumerixS Investment 
Technologies Inc acquired a new position in  Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth about $90,000.  Huntington 
National Bank lifted its position in  Ryanair by 21.2% during the 2nd quarter. Huntington National Bank now owns 
2,014 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $129,000 after buying an additional 352 shares in the last 
quarter.  Tower Research Capital LLC TRC acquired a new position in  Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth about 
$137,000.  Finally, Quantamental Technologies LLC lifted its position in  Ryanair by 89.4% during the 2nd quarter. 
Quantamental Technologies LLC now owns 3,269 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $210,000 
after buying an additional 1,543 shares in the last quarter. Institutional investors own  47.13% of the company's 
stock.  
Several brokerages recently issued reports on RYAAY. BidaskClub upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating 
to a "hold" rating in a research report on Saturday, September 21st. Canaccord Genuity downgraded shares of 
Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Wednesday, June 5th. Societe Generale 
downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Tuesday, August 6th. 
Raymond James reduced their price target on shares of Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" 
rating on the stock in a research report on Thursday, July 11th. Finally, Deutsche Bank upgraded shares of Ryanair 
from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report on Friday, June 7th. Seven investment analysts have rated 
the stock with a sell rating, three have given a hold rating and four have issued  a buy rating to the stock. The 
company  has an average rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $75.33. 
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  opened at $65.41 on Friday. The stock has a market capitalization of $14.72 billion, a 
P/E ratio of 12.73 and a beta of 0.79. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 1-year low of $55.75 and a 1-year high of $97.19. 
The company has a current ratio of 1.08, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79. The business has a 
50-day moving average price of $60.07 and a two-hundred day moving average price of $67.28.  
Bank of America Corp DE Has $37.98 Million Stock Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of 
$1.14 by $0.06. The firm had revenue of $2.60 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of 
$2.60 billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%.  As a group, equities analysts 
predict that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.07 EPS for the current year.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Body
Ryanair logo Verition Fund Management LLC bought a new stake in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) in 
the second quarter, according to its most recent disclosure with the Securities & Exchange Commission. The firm 
bought 27,534 shares of the transportation company's stock, valued at approximately $1,766,000.  
A number of other institutional investors also recently modified their holdings of the business. Atria Investments LLC 
increased its holdings in  Ryanair by 368,237.8% in the second quarter. Atria Investments LLC now owns 
11,591,591 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $11,592,000 after buying an additional 
11,588,444 shares in the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. grew its position in shares of  Ryanair by 9.0% in the 
second quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 7,198,559 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$461,715,000 after purchasing an additional 594,607 shares during the last quarter.  Lazard Asset Management 
LLC grew its position in shares of  Ryanair by 39.6% in the first quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC now owns 
6,533,662 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $489,632,000 after purchasing an additional 
1,854,616 shares during the last quarter.  WCM Investment Management LLC grew its position in shares of  
Ryanair by 1.5% in the first quarter. WCM Investment Management LLC now owns 4,339,799 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $325,225,000 after purchasing an additional 62,671 shares during the last 
quarter.  Finally, Janus Henderson Group PLC grew its position in shares of  Ryanair by 25.4% in the second 
quarter. Janus Henderson Group PLC now owns 2,979,797 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$191,124,000 after purchasing an additional 603,738 shares during the last quarter. 47.13% of the stock is owned 
by institutional investors.  
Several analysts have recently commented on RYAAY shares. Canaccord Genuity lowered shares of Ryanair from 
a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Wednesday, June 5th. BidaskClub upgraded shares of 
Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Saturday, September 21st. Deutsche Bank 
upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report on Friday, June 7th. Credit 
Suisse Group lowered shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underperform" rating in a research report on 
Tuesday, July 23rd. Finally, Morgan Stanley started coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research report on 
Wednesday, September 18th. They issued an "underweight" rating on the stock. Seven equities research analysts 
have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have issued  a hold rating and four have issued  a buy rating to the 
company's stock. Ryanair currently has an average rating of "Hold" and a consensus target price of $75.33. 
Verition Fund Management LLC Buys Shares of 27,534 Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
NASDAQ RYAAY  traded up $0.16 during mid-day trading on Friday, reaching $65.41. 348,500 shares of the stock 
were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 551,810. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 1-year low of $55.75 and 
a 1-year high of $97.19. The business's fifty day simple moving average is $60.07 and its 200 day simple moving 
average is $67.28. The stock has a market capitalization of $14.64 billion, a PE ratio of 12.73 and a beta of 0.79. 
The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a current ratio of 1.08.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company 
reported $1.20 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the Zacks' consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. 
Ryanair had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%. The firm had revenue of $2.60 billion for the 
quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 billion.  On average, analysts anticipate that  Ryanair Holdings plc 
will post 4.07 EPS for the current year.  
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

owned 129,018 shares of the transportation company's stock after selling 8,823 shares during the period. Bank of 
New York Mellon Corp owned 0.06% of Ryanair worth $8,274,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period.  
A number of other hedge funds also recently modified their holdings of RYAAY. Atria Investments LLC increased its 
position in  Ryanair by 368,237.8% during the second quarter. Atria Investments LLC now owns 11,591,591 shares 
of the transportation company's stock worth $11,592,000 after purchasing an additional 11,588,444 shares during 
the last quarter.  Lazard Asset Management LLC increased its position in shares of  Ryanair by 39.6% in the first 
quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC now owns 6,533,662 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$489,632,000 after acquiring an additional 1,854,616 shares in the last quarter.  Janus Henderson Group PLC 
increased its position in shares of  Ryanair by 25.4% in the second quarter. Janus Henderson Group PLC now 
owns 2,979,797 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $191,124,000 after acquiring an additional 
603,738 shares in the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. increased its position in shares of  Ryanair by 9.0% in the 
second quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 7,198,559 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$461,715,000 after acquiring an additional 594,607 shares in the last quarter.  Finally, Caisse DE Depot ET 
Placement DU Quebec increased its position in shares of  Ryanair by 33.2% in the second quarter. Caisse DE 
Depot ET Placement DU Quebec now owns 2,288,450 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$146,781,000 after acquiring an additional 569,880 shares in the last quarter. 47.13% of the stock is owned by 
hedge funds and other institutional investors.

on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Wednesday, September 18th. They issued an "underweight" rating for 
the company. JPMorgan Chase & Co. lowered shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating 
in a research report on Monday, July 29th. BidaskClub raised shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating 
in a research report on Saturday, September 21st. Raymond James dropped their price objective on shares of 
Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" rating for the company in a research report on Thursday, 
July 11th. Finally, Canaccord Genuity lowered shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research 
report on Wednesday, June 5th. Seven research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have issued  
a hold rating and four have assigned  a buy rating to the company's stock. The company presently has an average 
rating of "Hold" and a consensus target price of $75.33.

consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%. The

Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Short Interest Update
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Short Interest Update
American Banking and Market News
September 27, 2019 Friday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 767 words
Body
Ryanair logo Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) was the recipient of a large drop in short interest in 
September. As of September 15th, there was short interest totalling 710,400 shares,  a drop of 38.8% from the 
August 15th total of 1,160,000 shares. Approximately 0.3% of the shares of the stock are sold short. Based on an 
average daily volume of 558,700 shares, the short-interest ratio is currently 1.3 days.  
RYAAY has been the subject of several research analyst reports. Raymond James dropped their price objective on 
Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" rating for the company in a research note on Thursday, July 
11th. Societe Generale downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Tuesday, 
August 6th. BidaskClub raised Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Saturday, 
September 21st. JPMorgan Chase & Co. downgraded Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a 
research note on Monday, July 29th. Finally, Credit Suisse Group downgraded Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an 
"underperform" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 23rd. Seven research analysts have rated the stock with 
a sell rating, three have given a hold rating and four have assigned  a buy rating to the company's stock. The stock 
currently has an average rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $75.33. 
Ryanair stock  traded down $0.06 during mid-day trading on Friday, hitting $65.19. 12,568 shares of the company 
were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 565,924. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a 
current ratio of 1.08 and a quick ratio of 1.08. The business's 50 day simple moving average is $60.00 and its two-
hundred day simple moving average is $67.32. The company has a market capitalization of $14.69 billion, a P/E 
ratio of 12.67 and a beta of 0.79. Ryanair has a 12-month low of $55.75 and a 12-month high of $97.95.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its quarterly earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. The 
company had revenue of $2.60 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $2.60 billion. 
Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%.  Equities research analysts predict that  
Ryanair will post 4.07 earnings per share for the current year.  
Institutional investors have recently added to or reduced their stakes in the business. Atria Investments LLC 
boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 368,237.8% during the second quarter. Atria Investments LLC now 
owns 11,591,591 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $11,592,000 after purchasing an additional 
11,588,444 shares during the last quarter.  Lazard Asset Management LLC boosted its holdings in shares of  
Ryanair by 39.6% during the first quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC now owns 6,533,662 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $489,632,000 after purchasing an additional 1,854,616 shares during the last 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Short Interest Update
quarter.  Janus Henderson Group PLC boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 25.4% during the second 
quarter. Janus Henderson Group PLC now owns 2,979,797 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$191,124,000 after purchasing an additional 603,738 shares during the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. boosted 
its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 9.0% during the second quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 7,198,559 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $461,715,000 after purchasing an additional 594,607 shares 
during the last quarter.  Finally, Caisse DE Depot ET Placement DU Quebec boosted its holdings in shares of  
Ryanair by 33.2% during the second quarter. Caisse DE Depot ET Placement DU Quebec now owns 2,288,450 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $146,781,000 after purchasing an additional 569,880 shares 
during the last quarter. 47.13% of the stock is owned by institutional investors.  
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Sep 27, 2019( Transcript Daily: https://transcriptdaily.com Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) was the recipient of a large drop in short interest in September. As of September 15th, there 
was short interest totalling 710,400 shares, a drop of 38.8% from the August 15th total of 1,160,000 shares. 
Approximately 0.3% of the shares of the stock are sold short. 
Based on an average daily volume of 558,700 shares, the short-interest ratio is currently 1.3 days. RYAAY has 
been the subject of several research analyst reports. Raymond James dropped their price objective on Ryanair 
from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" rating for the company in a research note on Thursday, July 11th. 
Societe Generale downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Tuesday, August 
6th. BidaskClub raised Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Saturday, September 
21st. JPMorgan Chase .... downgraded Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a research note 
on Monday, July 29th. Finally, Credit Suisse Group downgraded Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an 
"underperform" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 23rd. Seven research analysts have rated the stock with 
a sell rating, three have given a hold rating and four have assigned a buy rating to the company's stock. The stock 
currently has an average rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $75.33.Ryanair stock[1] traded down $0.06 
during mid-day trading on Friday, hitting $65.19. 12,568 shares of the company were exchanged, compared to its 
average volume of 565,924. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a current ratio of 1.08 and a quick ratio 
of 1.08. The business's 50 day simple moving average is $60.00 and its two-hundred day simple moving average is 
$67.32. The company has a market capitalization of $14.69 billion, a P/E ratio of 12.67 and a beta of 0.79. Ryanair 
has a 12-month low of $55.75 and a 12-month high of $97.95. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its 
quarterly earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company reported $1.20 earnings per share for 
the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. The company had revenue of $2.60 billion during 
the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $2.60 billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a 
net margin of 10.47%. Equities research analysts predict that Ryanair will post 4.07 earnings per share for the 
current year. Institutional investors have recently added to or reduced their stakes in the business. Atria 
Investments LLC boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 368,237.8% during the second quarter. Atria 
Investments LLC now owns 11,591,591 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $11,592,000 after

6,533,662 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $489,632,000 after purchasing an additional 
1,854,616 shares during the last quarter. Janus Henderson Group PLC boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by

Sep 27, 2019( Week Herald: https://weekherald.com Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) was the target of a significant decrease in short interest in the month of September. As of 
September 15th, there was short interest totalling 710,400 shares, a decrease of 38.8% from the August 15th total 
of 1,160,000 shares. Currently, 0.3% of the company's shares are sold short. 
Based on an average daily volume of 558,700 shares, the short-interest ratio is presently 1.3 days. Institutional 
investors and hedge funds have recently modified their holdings of the company. Manchester Financial Inc. 
purchased a new stake in shares of Ryanair during the 2nd quarter valued at $35,000. NumerixS Investment 
Technologies Inc purchased a new position in Ryanair in the 2nd quarter worth $90,000. Westwood Holdings Group 
Inc. purchased a new position in Ryanair in the 2nd quarter worth $114,000. Huntington National Bank raised its 
stake in Ryanair by 21.2% in the 2nd quarter. Huntington National Bank now owns 2,014 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $129,000 after acquiring an additional 352 shares during the last quarter. 
Finally, Tower Research Capital LLC TRC purchased a new position in Ryanair in the 2nd quarter worth $137,000.

compared to its average volume of 565,924. The business has a fifty day moving average of $60.00 and a 200 day 
moving average of $67.32. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a current ratio 
of 1.08. The firm has a market cap of $14.69 billion, a P/E ratio of 12.70 and a beta of 0.79. Ryanair has a 12-month 
low of $55.75 and a 12-month high of $97.95. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on 
Monday, July 29th. The transportation company reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, topping analysts' 
consensus estimates of $1.14 by $0.06. The company had revenue of $2.60 billion during the quarter, compared to 
analyst estimates of $2.60 billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%. Sell-side 
analysts predict that Ryanair will post 4.07 EPS for the current year. A number of research analysts have recently 
commented on RYAAY shares. Societe Generale cut Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research 
note on Tuesday, August 6th. Deutsche Bank raised Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research 
note on Friday, June 7th. Morgan Stanley started coverage on Ryanair in a research note on Wednesday, 
September 18th. They set an "underweight" rating on the stock. BidaskClub raised Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a

rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Wednesday, June 5th. Seven investment analysts have rated the

Jack Whitehall told to act 'more relatable' so he doesn't alienate his fans
Jack Whitehall told to act 'more relatable' so he doesn't alienate his fans
Newstex Blogs 
BANG ShowBiz
September 27, 2019 Friday 9:30 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 360 words
Body
Sep 27, 2019( BANG ShowBiz: http://www.bangshowbiz.com Delivered by Newstex)  Jack Whitehall has been told 
to act "more relatable" to keep his fans on board.The 'Jungle Cruise' actor and comedian is currently on tour, and 
he admitted his own team have told him he needs to appear more down-to-earth to ensure he doesn't alienate any 
o his fans.Speaking during a talk at London's Southbank Centre this week, he's quoted by The Sun newspaper's 
Bizarre column as saying: "I've just started doing a tour and I've been told I need to look more relatable, so I now 
need to lie and pretend that I fly on Ryanair and not boujee airlines."They also told me I need to stop talking about 
Waitrose on stage. They say I talk about Waitrose too much, so now I have to pretend I'm a normal person and 
shop at Lidl."The 30-year-old comic is no stranger to luxury, and he was selected to provide the entertainment for 
Prince Charles' annual staff Christmas Party last year.However, Jack admitted he "absolutely died" on stage in front 
of the 70-year-old royal with none of his material going down well at all.He recalled: "It was an honor to be asked to 
do the Christmas party of Prince Charles... he throws [his staff] a Christmas party each year... and I was the 
entertainment that year. 
It's the weirdest gig ever."I walk out, first thing that's weird is that they're sat in the front row, Charles and Camilla, in 
thrones... Also, don't sit in the front row because that's your get-out-of-jail-free card as a comic, [you pick on the 
front row], you ask them what they do for a living... I can't ask Prince Charles what he does for a living!"[It was a] 
small room, maybe 40 people, all of my material was terrible... I absolutely died."And things only got worse for Jack 
as he overheard the prince suggesting to his wife, Duchess Camilla, that they opt for a very different form of 
entertainment in future.He added: "And the worst bit was, when I was walking off because nobody was applauding, 
it was the worst review I've ever got, I heard Charles turn to Camilla as I was leaving the stage and he went 'I think 
next year we'll try a magician'... There goes the knighthood!" 
Load-Date: September 27, 2019
End of Document

American Banking and Market News
September 26, 2019 Thursday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 757 words
Body
Ryanair logo Bamco Inc. NY increased its holdings in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 26.2% in the 
second quarter, according to its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The firm owned 
53,025 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 11,000 shares during the 
quarter. Bamco Inc. NY's holdings in Ryanair were worth $3,401,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period.

Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair has no Condor takeover plans but doesn't rule out investment
Ryanair has no Condor takeover plans but doesn't rule out investment
dpa international (Englischer Dienst)
September 26, 2019 Thursday 4:46 PM GMT
Copyright 2019 Deutsche Presse-Agentur All Rights Reserved
Length: 264 words
Dateline: Vienna (dpa) - 
Body
Budget airline Ryanair is not interested in buying Thomas Cook subsidiary Condor but would consider acquiring 
parts of the German holiday carrier if it is split up to guarantee competition, Ryanair chief executive Michael O'Leary 
said Thursday.
The head of Europe's largest budget carrier charged that the German government's recent 380-million-euro (420-
million-dollar) bridge loan for Condor was in preparation for Lufthansa buying another German airline and gaining 
market dominance.
"This is yet another fattening up of a German turkey," O'Leary told a press conference in Vienna, the base of 
Ryanair's Austrian subsidiary Laudamotion.
British tour operator Thomas Cook collapsed and filed for liquidation on Monday, leaving tens of thousands of 
holidaymakers stranded. Unlike its parent company, Condor is solvent and continues to operate, but has obtained a 
bridging loan to guard against potential liquidity shortages.
O'Leary said European Competition Commissioner Margrethe Vestager should not only look at US giants like 
Amazon and Google, but at Germany's Lufthansa. He pointed to the German carrier's past acquisition of troubled 
Air Berlin.
If Lufthansa ended up swallowing Condor, "we would expect there to be competition divestments" that might be of 
interest to Ryanair, the head of Ireland-based airline said.
Lufthansa made a non-binding offer for Condor in May but has not confirmed this week whether it is still interested. 
However, Lufthansa has never officially withdrawn its bid.
Editorial contactsEditing by: Christopher Cermak, +49 30 2852 31472; <international@dpa.com;

Flier growth at Southend helps Stobart Group
Flier growth at Southend helps Stobart Group
City A.M.
September 26, 2019 Thursday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 City A.M. All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; TEASERS; Pg. 16
Length: 278 words
Byline: ANNA MENIN
Body
STOBART Group yesterday said it is trading in line with expectations and has made "considerable progress" during 
the first half of the year.
The aviation, energy and civil engineering group suffered a bruising boardroom battle last year, resulting in the 
ousting of former boss Andrew Tinkler.
Stobart made "strong commercial progress" in its aviation and energy divisions during the first half, the group said 
in a trading update issued ahead of the publication of its interim results for the six months to 31 August on 14 
November.
Passenger numbers at London Southend Airport, which the group owns, increased 42 per cent compared to the 
same period last year.
The group said this growth was driven by Ryanair starting flights from the airport in April, and Loganair flights in 
May. The successful growth of Easyjet flights and the introduction of early and late rail services between Liverpool 
Street station and the airport.
Wizzair will begin flying from London Southend to three new destinations from October, which Stobart said would 
help keep passenger numbers increasing in line with its target. Stobart said it is taking a cautious approach to 
passenger forecasts "given the ongoing uncertainty in the sector, in part caused by Brexit".
In the group's energy division, the volume of waste managed - which is primarily processed into waste wood fuel - 
increased by 148,000 tonnes to 806,000 tones. The equivalent run rate of 1.7m tonnes per year represents a 22 per 
cent increase, Stobart said.
Flier growth at Southend helps Stobart Group
"Stobart Group has made considerable progress in the period. I am particularly encouraged by the airline partners 
we are working with," said chief executive Warwick Brady.
Load-Date: September 26, 2019
End of Document
Aer Lingus owner IAG warns of profit hit from pilot strikes
Aer Lingus owner IAG warns of profit hit from pilot strikes
Business World (Digest)
September 26, 2019 Thursday
Copyright 2019 Media World Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: IRELAND
Length: 181 words
Byline: Business World
Body
Aer Lingus owner IAG warned on Thursday full-year operating pretax profit will be 215 million euros lower than last 
year, as major pilot strikes grounded thousands of flights.
IAG, which reported a profit of 3.49 billion euros last year, expects the strikes to hit the company by 137 million 
euros, with a further 33 million euro impact because of "threatened strikes" by Heathrow Airport employees.
The strikes in September backed by the pilots' union, the British Airline Pilots Association (BALPA), led to an initial 
cancellation of 4,521 flights over seven days.
British Airways pilots had cancelled a strike set for Sept. 27 to create time for talks. BA has offered its pilots an 
11.5% pay rise over three years.
"There have been no further talks between British Airways and BALPA," the company said on Thursday.
The airline, whose competition includes easyJet, Ryanair and other low-cost airlines, estimates booking trends in its 
low cost segments will be hurt by 45 million euros.
Shares were seen falling 5% to 7%, according to premarket indicators. (Reuters)
Source: www.businessworld.ie
Load-Date: October 16, 2019
Aer Lingus owner IAG warns of profit hit from pilot strikes
End of Document
The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: SkyWest , Ryanair , Copa and Global Partners
The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: SkyWest, Ryanair, Copa and Global 
Partners
Newstex Blogs 
Zacks Investment Research
September 26, 2019 Thursday 1:41 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1572 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Sep 26, 2019( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) ; For Immediate 
ReleaseChicago, IL -September 26, 2019 - Zacks.com announces the list of stocks featured in the Analyst Blog. 
Every day the Zacks Equity Research analysts discuss the latest news and events impacting stocks and the 
financial markets. Stocks recently featured in the blog include: SkyWest, Inc. SKYW[1], Ryanair Holdings plc 
RYAAY[2], Copa Holdings, S.A. CPA[3] and Global Partners LP GLP[4].Here are highlights from Monday's Analyst 
Blog:Buy These Stocks as Oil Slips to Lowest Since Aramco AttacksOil prices slumped more than 2% on Sep 24, 
touching the lowest level since the attacks on Saudi Arabia's key oil production facilities. 
This has been primarily led by President Trump's disturbing rhetoric in relation to the trade conflict with 
China.Trump accused China of manipulating its currency and stealing intellectual property, in a U.N. speech. He 
specified that he won't accept a "bad deal" in trade talks with China. It's worth pointing out that China is the world's 
largest importer of oil and also the second-largest crude user. The United States, in the meanwhile, is the largest 
consumer of oil.Such developments are working against the oil market, especially, after oil rallied last week 
following a crippling attack on Saudi oil installations. The coordinated drone strikes on key Saudi oil facilities have 
removed nearly 5% of global supplies.U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said that the attack was a 'state-on-
state act of war' by Iran, but the United States is still committed toward finding a diplomatic solution with Iran. U.S. 
Secretary of Defense Mark Esper added that the United States will send troops to Saudi Arabia but that would be 
'defensive in nature.' U.S. treasury secretary Steven Mnuchin stated that 'the United States will continue its 
maximum pressure campaign against Iran's repressive regime, which attempts to achieve its revolutionary agenda 
through regional aggression while squandering the country's oil proceeds.'The coordinated drone strikes affected 
the world's largest oil procession plant. In fact, Saudi Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman said that almost 
5.7 million barrels a day of crude oil and gas have been affected.Nonetheless, oil prices extended losses after 
industry data showed unanticipated buildup in U.S. crude stockpiles. The American Petroleum Institute said that 
U.S. crude inventories rose 1.4 million barrels last week, way more than analysts' estimate of 200,000-barrel 
drawdown.But, the drop in crude oil prices has been a blessing for aviation and refinery companies. Here's why —
Aviation, Refiners Poised to GainAviation stocks traditionally have an inverse relationship with the movement of oil 
prices. So, it isn't surprising that shares of aviation firms are rising after the sharp drop in oil. As fuel costs form a 
major part of the operating costs for aviation firms, a rise in oil prices eats into profit margins.Refineries also stand 
The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: SkyWest , Ryanair , Copa and Global Partners
to gain from the drop in crude oil prices. Refineries buy crude oil as their raw materials. So, refineries' net cash flow 
declines if crude oil prices rise. Meanwhile, their net cash flow increases when crude oil prices fall.4 Solid PicksWe 
have, thus, selected four such stocks from the aforesaid areas that are poised to make the most of the crude oil fall. 
These stocks also boast a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) or 2 (Buy).SkyWest, Inc. operates a regional airline in the 
United States. The company has a Zacks Rank #2. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for its current-year earnings 
has moved up 1.3% in the last 60 days. The company's expected earnings growth rate for the current year is 16.6% 
compared with the Transportation - Airline[5] industry's estimated rise of 8.8%.Ryanair Holdings plcprovides 
scheduled-passenger airline services. The company has a Zacks Rank #2. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for its 
current-year earnings has moved up 0.5% in the last 60 days. The company's expected earnings growth rate for the 
next year is 32.4% compared with the Transportation - Airline industry's projected rally of 15.3%.Copa Holdings, 
S.A. provides airline passenger and cargo services. The company offers flights to 81 destinations in 33 countries in 
North, Central, and South America, as well as the Caribbean. The company has a Zacks Rank #1. The Zacks 
Consensus Estimate for its current-year earnings has moved up 10.8% in the last 60 days. The company's 
expected earnings growth rate for the current year is 21.6% compared with the Transportation - Airline industry's 
expected rise of 8.8%. You can see the complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank stocks here[6].Global Partners 
LPengages in the purchasing, selling, gathering, blending, storing, and logistics of transporting gasoline and 
gasoline blendstocks, distillates, residual oil, renewable fuels, crude oil, and propane to wholesalers, retailers, and 
commercial customers. The company has a Zacks Rank #2. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for its current-year 
earnings has moved up 20.9% in the last 60 days. The company's expected earnings growth rate for the current 
quarter is 115.9% compared with the Oil and Gas - Refining and Marketing - Master Limited Partnerships[7] 
industry's projected rally of 72.2%.5 Stocks Set to DoubleEach was hand-picked by a Zacks expert as the #1 
favorite stock to gain +100% or more in 2020. Each comes from a different sector and has unique qualities and 
catalysts that could fuel exceptional growth.Most of the stocks in this report are flying under Wall Street radar, which 
provides a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor.Today, See These 5 Potential Home Runs >>[8]Media

Ryanair (LON:RYA) Earns 'Sell' Rating from JPMorgan Chase Co.
Ryanair (LON:RYA) Earns 'Sell' Rating from JPMorgan Chase Co.
Newstex Blogs 
TheOlympiaReport
September 26, 2019 Thursday 10:06 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 285 words
Body
Sep 26, 2019( TheOlympiaReport: https://theolympiareport.com Delivered by Newstex)             
https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.pngJPMorgan Chase ....[1] reaffirmed their sell rating

Sep 25, 2019( Chaffey Breeze: https://www.chaffeybreeze.com Delivered by Newstex)  Tower Research Capital 
LLC TRC bought a new position in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) during the 2nd quarter, according to its 
most recent disclosure with the Securities ...change Commission. The fund bought 2,139 shares of the 
transportation company's stock, valued at approximately $137,000. Several other hedge funds have also recently 
modified their holdings of RYAAY. California Public Employees Retirement System bought a new stake in Ryanair 
during the first quarter worth approximately $6,950,000. Raymond James ...sociates increased its stake in Ryanair 
by 13.6% during the first quarter.
