Sep 12, 2019( Chaffey Breeze: https://www.chaffeybreeze.com Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) 
was upgraded by BidaskClub[1] from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a research report issued to clients and 
investors on Tuesday, BidAskClub[2] reports.A number of other equities research analysts also recently issued 
reports on RYAAY. Raymond James lowered their target price on shares of Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and set 
an "outperform" rating for the company in a report on Thursday, July 11th. Societe Generale downgraded shares of 
Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, August 6th. 
HSBC downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "reduce" rating in a report on Wednesday, May 22nd. 
Canaccord Genuity cut shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Wednesday, 
June 5th. Finally, Deutsche Bank raised shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report 
on Friday, June 7th. Seven investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have given a hold 
rating and four have assigned a buy rating to the stock. The stock has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average 
target price of $75.33.Ryanair stock[3] traded down $2.14 during trading on Tuesday, reaching $61.00. The 
company had a trading volume of 391,019 shares, compared to its average volume of 712,945. Ryanair has a 12-
month low of $55.75 and a 12-month high of $99.89. The stock's 50 day moving average price is $59.74 and its 
two-hundred day moving average price is $68.17. The firm has a market capitalization of $14.09 billion, a price-to-
earnings ratio of 11.87 and a beta of 0.79. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a quick ratio of 1.08 and 
a current ratio of 1.08. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The 
transportation company reported $1.20 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, beating analysts' consensus 
estimates of $1.14 by $0.06. Ryanair had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%. The firm had 
revenue of $2.60 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $2.60 billion. As a group, 
research analysts expect that Ryanair will post 4.07 earnings per share for the current year. A number of hedge 
funds have recently made changes to their positions in RYAAY. Manchester Financial Inc. acquired a new position 
in shares of Ryanair during the second quarter worth $35,000. NumerixS Investment Technologies Inc acquired a 
new position in shares of Ryanair during the second quarter worth $90,000. Westwood Holdings Group Inc. 
acquired a new position in shares of Ryanair during the second quarter worth $114,000. Huntington National Bank 
lifted its position in shares of Ryanair by 21.2% during the second quarter. Huntington National Bank now owns 
2,014 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $129,000 after purchasing an additional 352 shares in the 
last quarter. Finally, Tower Research Capital LLC TRC acquired a new position in shares of Ryanair during the 
second quarter worth $137,000. 47.17% of the stock is currently owned by hedge funds and other institutional 
investors. Ryanair Company ProfileRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-

European ADRs Edge Higher in Wednesday Trading
European ADRs Edge Higher in Wednesday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
September 11, 2019 Wednesday 10:59 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 208 words
Body
 American depositary receipts of European stocks were trading 0.14% higher at 1,013.77 on the BNY Mellon 
Europe Select ADR Index on Wednesday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by 3D printer makers Materialise (MTLS) and voxeljet (VJET), which 
climbed 5.8% and 4.3% respectively. They were followed by biopharmaceutical firm Genfit (GNFT) and biotech 
company Forward Pharma (FWP), which rose 3.7% and 3.4%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by furniture maker Natuzzi (NTZ) and bank Banco Santander (SAN), 
which fell 3.3% and 1.9% respectively. They were followed by dating app operator Spark Networks (LOV), which fell 
1%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by biopharmaceutical company Bicycle Therapeutics Limited (BCYC), 
which surged 20.9%, followed by biotech firms GW Pharmaceuticals (GWPH) and Trinity Biotech (TRIB), which 
were up 4.5% and 3.2% respectively. Airline operator Ryanair (RYAAY) was moving 2.3% higher.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by biopharmaceutical firms NuCana (NCNA) and Adaptimmune 
Therapeutics (ADAP), which were down 3.9% and 2.8% respectively. They were followed by biotech company 
Autolus Therapeutics (AUTL), which fell 1.1%.

M&T Bank Corp Reduces Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
M&T Bank Corp Reduces Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
September 10, 2019 Tuesday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 708 words
Body
Ryanair logo M&T Bank Corp lessened its position in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 54.0% during the 
second quarter, according to the company in its most recent filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission. The 
fund owned 18,934 shares of the transportation company's stock after selling 22,192 shares during the period. M&T 
Bank Corp's holdings in Ryanair were worth $1,215,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period.  
Other hedge funds have also recently added to or reduced their stakes in the company. LPL Financial LLC boosted 
its holdings in  Ryanair by 21.4% in the second quarter. LPL Financial LLC now owns 4,219 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $271,000 after acquiring an additional 743 shares in the last quarter.  U S 
Global Investors Inc. raised its holdings in  Ryanair by 11.9% in the 2nd quarter. U S Global Investors Inc. now 
owns 10,573 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $678,000 after acquiring an additional 1,123 
shares during the last quarter.  Oppenheimer Asset Management Inc. lifted its position in  Ryanair by 120.5% in the 
2nd quarter. Oppenheimer Asset Management Inc. now owns 15,634 shares of the transportation company's stock 
valued at $1,003,000 after acquiring an additional 8,544 shares in the last quarter.  Caisse DE Depot ET Placement 
DU Quebec lifted its position in  Ryanair by 33.2% in the 2nd quarter. Caisse DE Depot ET Placement DU Quebec 
now owns 2,288,450 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $146,781,000 after acquiring an 
additional 569,880 shares in the last quarter.  Finally, Trexquant Investment LP purchased a new stake in  Ryanair 
during the 2nd quarter valued at $405,000. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own  47.17% of the 
company's stock.  
Ryanair stock  opened at $60.16 on Tuesday. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52-week low of $55.75 and a 52-week 
high of $99.89. The company has a market cap of $13.97 billion, a P/E ratio of 12.48 and a beta of 0.79. The 
company has a quick ratio of 1.08, a current ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79. The business has a 50-
day simple moving average of $59.86 and a two-hundred day simple moving average of $68.28.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of 
$1.14 by $0.06. The firm had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $2.60 
billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%.  Research analysts anticipate that  
Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.07 EPS for the current fiscal year.  
RYAAY has been the subject of a number of research analyst reports. Societe Generale lowered Ryanair from a 
"buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, August 6th. HSBC lowered Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a 
M&T Bank Corp Reduces Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
"reduce" rating in a research report on Wednesday, May 22nd. JPMorgan Chase & Co. cut shares of Ryanair from 
a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a research note on Monday, July 29th. Deutsche Bank raised shares 
of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Friday, June 7th. Finally, Credit Suisse Group lowered 
shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underperform" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 23rd. 
Seven equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have assigned  a hold rating and four 
have given a buy rating to the stock. Ryanair currently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus price 
target of $75.33. 
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

No smooth flying for BA with Cruz in control THE CITY VIEW
No smooth flying for BA with Cruz in control; THE CITY VIEW
City A.M.
September 10, 2019 Tuesday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 City A.M. All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 2
Length: 445 words
Body
TO FLY. To serve. It may be the tagline of one of the UK's best known brands, but passengers of British Airways 
can be forgiven for grimacing at what has been dished out to them recently. 
In the past two years, BA customers have endured data leaks affecting more than 550,000, an IT meltdown which 
cost the firm £58m, and days of strike action, which this week alone grounded 1,700 flights, left its Heathrow T5 hub 
a ghost town and is costing the airline at least £40m a day. All on top of the usual 'travel chaos' weather events 
which affect all carriers. The brand damage follows BA's much-derided move down-market to scrap free seat 
selection and food and drink on economy shorthaul flights in a cost-cutting drive to compete with budget carriers. 
The budget-busting coincided with Alex Cruz buckling into the chief executive's chair at BA in early 2016, having led 
its sister airline, Vueling, which follows the low-cost model. If anything, the showdown with the well-paid pilots at the 
British Airline Pilots' Association union is all part of a cost-cutting strategy which the airline's parent, International 
Airlines Group (IAG), had demanded. The ensuing stand-off spilling out of mediation, ruining travel plans and 
inflicting even more damage to the airline's dented brand, was less of a certainty, but deemed necessary to reverse 
IAG's share price decline which analysts say was sky-high this time last year based in-part on Cruz's cost control. 
Keeping a handle on pilots' pay will be worth yesterday's share slide in the long-run and is yet another test for Cruz 
who is charged by IAG head office to balance competing with the likes of Emirates on long-haul and Ryanair and 
Easyjet on short-haul routes. It isn't an easy balancing act. While you won't have to search far to find a leisure or 
business passenger who has sworn off the British flag-carrier, City analysts and IAG are keeping the faith that the 
BA boss will continue to deliver profitability (making around £2bn in profits in 2018) for the mothership. Aviation 
analysts agree that the airline's financial performance is somewhat insulated from headline-grabbing mishaps, IT 
underinvestment and a much-diluted brand power. That profit protection is due to a legacy issue from well before 
Cruz's tenure and more permanent than a few PR disasters: Heathrow airport. It's full, but BA has 55 per cent of all 
the landing slots. And BA's London hub remains the airport of choice for its sought-after high-value travellers. The 
No smooth flying for BA with Cruz in control THE CITY VIEW
summer slide of its share and reputation is unwelcome turbulence for the airline - and its customers. This week's 
battle may prove a necessary blip on the radar in the long-haul.
Load-Date: September 10, 2019
End of Document

Brokerages Set Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) PT at $76.50
Brokerages Set Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) PT at $76.50
Newstex Blogs 
Highlight Press
September 10, 2019 Tuesday 7:15 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 788 words
Byline: Felipe Cruz-Ramos
Body
Sep 10, 2019( Highlight Press: http://highlightpress.com Delivered by Newstex)  Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) have been given a consensus rating of 'Hold' by the fifteen analysts that are presently covering 
the firm, MarketBeat[1] reports. Seven analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have given a hold 
rating and four have given a buy rating to the company. The average 12-month target price among brokers that 
have issued a report on the stock in the last year is $76.50.  Several brokerages have recently commented on 
RYAAY. 
Credit Suisse Group downgraded shares of Ryanair from a 'neutral' rating to an 'underperform' rating in a report on 
Tuesday, July 23rd. Raymond James dropped their price target on Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an 
'outperform' rating on the stock in a report on Thursday, July 11th. HSBC cut Ryanair from a 'hold' rating to a 
'reduce' rating in a research report on Wednesday, May 22nd. Societe Generale downgraded Ryanair from a 'buy' 
rating to a 'hold' rating in a research note on Tuesday, August 6th. Finally, Canaccord Genuity downgraded Ryanair 
from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a research note on Wednesday, June 5th.  Several institutional investors have 
recently added to or reduced their stakes in RYAAY. BB...orp lifted its stake in shares of Ryanair by 38.1% during 
the 2nd quarter. BB...orp now owns 6,103 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $391,000 after 
buying an additional 1,684 shares in the last quarter. Baldwin Investment Management LLC grew its stake in 
Ryanair by 3.3% in the first quarter. Baldwin Investment Management LLC now owns 9,341 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $700,000 after purchasing an additional 300 shares during the period. First 
Pacific Advisors LP grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 9.3% in the 1st quarter. First Pacific Advisors LP now 
owns 78,303 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $5,868,000 after buying an additional 6,690 
shares during the period. WCM Investment Management LLC increased its stake in shares of Ryanair by 1.5% in 
the 1st quarter. WCM Investment Management LLC now owns 4,339,799 shares of the transportation company's 
stock worth $325,225,000 after acquiring an additional 62,671 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Parametric 
Portfolio Associates LLC lifted its position in Ryanair by 7.0% during the 1st quarter. Parametric Portfolio Associates 
LLC now owns 156,468 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $11,726,000 after acquiring an 
additional 10,230 shares during the period. 47.17% of the stock is owned by hedge funds and other institutional 
investors.    Ryanair stock[2] traded up $1.86 during trading on Friday, hitting $62.02. 14,468 shares of the 
company were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 554,357. The company has a market capitalization 
of $13.97 billion, a P/E ratio of 12.05 and a beta of 0.79. The business's 50 day moving average is $59.86 and its 
Brokerages Set Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) PT at $76.50
200 day moving average is $68.28. Ryanair has a 52 week low of $55.75 and a 52 week high of $99.89. The 
company has a current ratio of 1.08, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79.  Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company 
reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. The business 
had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $2.60 billion. Ryanair had a 
return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%. Equities analysts expect that Ryanair will post 4.07 EPS for 
the current year.  About Ryanair Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger 
airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the

Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Position Boosted by Oppenheimer Asset Management Inc.
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Position Boosted by Oppenheimer 
Asset Management Inc.
American Banking and Market News
September 9, 2019 Monday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 782 words
Body
Ryanair logo Oppenheimer Asset Management Inc. boosted its holdings in  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 120.5% during the 2nd quarter, according to the company in its most recent filing with the 
Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The firm owned 15,634 shares of the transportation company's stock 
after acquiring an additional 8,544 shares during the quarter. Oppenheimer Asset Management Inc.'s holdings in 
Ryanair were worth $1,003,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  
A number of other institutional investors have also made changes to their positions in the business. Atria 
Investments LLC boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 368,237.8% in the second quarter. Atria Investments 
LLC now owns 11,591,591 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $11,592,000 after acquiring an 
additional 11,588,444 shares in the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. boosted its stake in  Ryanair by 9.0% during 
the 2nd quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 7,198,559 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$461,715,000 after purchasing an additional 594,607 shares in the last quarter.  Lazard Asset Management LLC 
boosted its stake in  Ryanair by 39.6% during the 1st quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC now owns 6,533,662 
shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $489,632,000 after purchasing an additional 1,854,616 
shares in the last quarter.  WCM Investment Management LLC increased its position in shares of  Ryanair by 1.5% 
during the 1st quarter. WCM Investment Management LLC now owns 4,339,799 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $325,225,000 after purchasing an additional 62,671 shares during the period.  Finally, 
Janus Henderson Group PLC increased its position in shares of  Ryanair by 25.4% during the 2nd quarter. Janus 
Henderson Group PLC now owns 2,979,797 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $191,124,000 
after purchasing an additional 603,738 shares during the period. 47.17% of the stock is currently owned by hedge 
funds and other institutional investors.  
Several analysts have recently weighed in on RYAAY shares. JPMorgan Chase & Co. lowered Ryanair from a 
"neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a report on Monday, July 29th. Societe Generale downgraded shares 
of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, August 6th. Credit Suisse Group 
downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underperform" rating in a report on Tuesday, July 23rd. 
Canaccord Genuity lowered shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on 
Wednesday, June 5th. Finally, HSBC cut shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "reduce" rating in a research 
note on Wednesday, May 22nd. Seven analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have issued  a hold 
rating and four have assigned  a buy rating to the company's stock. The company presently has a consensus rating 
of "Hold" and a consensus price target of $75.33. 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Position Boosted by Oppenheimer Asset Management Inc.
Shares of Ryanair stock  traded up $0.50 on Monday, reaching $60.14. 11,370 shares of the company were 
exchanged, compared to its average volume of 564,160. Ryanair Holdings plc has a fifty-two week low of $55.75 
and a fifty-two week high of $99.89. The firm has a market capitalization of $13.97 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio 
of 11.72 and a beta of 0.79. The company has a current ratio of 1.08, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio 
of 0.79. The stock has a fifty day moving average price of $60.13 and a 200-day moving average price of $68.48.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company 
reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. The business 
had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $2.60 billion. Ryanair had a net 
margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%.  On average, equities analysts anticipate that  Ryanair 
Holdings plc will post 4.07 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

investor  owned 72,318 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 4,090 shares 
during the quarter. Ryanair accounts for about  1.6% of Lafayette Investments Inc.'s holdings, making the stock its

recent reporting period.

$1,003,000 after purchasing an additional 8,544 shares during the last quarter.  Finally, Caisse DE Depot ET 
Placement DU Quebec raised its position in  Ryanair by 33.2% during the 2nd quarter. Caisse DE Depot ET 
Placement DU Quebec now owns 2,288,450 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $146,781,000 
after purchasing an additional 569,880 shares during the last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional investors 
own  46.03% of the company's stock.  
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  traded up $0.79 during trading on Friday, hitting $59.64. The stock had a trading 
volume of 389,482 shares, compared to its average volume of 564,160. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12 month low of 
$55.75 and a 12 month high of $99.89. The company has a market capitalization of $13.78 billion, a PE ratio of 
11.60 and a beta of 0.79. The firm's fifty day moving average is $60.13 and its 200 day moving average is $68.48. 
The company has a quick ratio of 1.08, a current ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company 
reported $1.20 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. 
Lafayette Investments Inc. Boosts Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%. The firm had revenue of $2.60 billion during 
the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 billion.  Equities research analysts expect that  Ryanair 
Holdings plc will post 4.07 EPS for the current fiscal year.  
RYAAY has been the subject of several research reports. JPMorgan Chase & Co. lowered Ryanair from a "neutral" 
rating to an "underweight" rating in a research report on Monday, July 29th. HSBC lowered Ryanair from a "hold" 
rating to a "reduce" rating in a research report on Wednesday, May 22nd. Societe Generale lowered Ryanair from a 
"buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Tuesday, August 6th. BidaskClub lowered Ryanair from a 
"sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a research report on Tuesday, July 30th. Finally, Deutsche Bank raised 
Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report on Friday, June 7th. Seven investment analysts 
have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have assigned  a hold rating and four have issued  a buy rating to the 
company. Ryanair currently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average target price of $75.33. 
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Given Consensus Rating of "Hold" by Analysts
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Given Consensus Rating of "Hold" 
by Analysts
American Banking and Market News
September 7, 2019 Saturday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 707 words
Body
Ryanair logo Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) has earned an average rating of "Hold" from the fifteen 
ratings firms that are presently  covering the stock,            MarketBeat  reports. Seven equities research analysts 
have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have assigned  a hold rating and four have issued  a buy rating on  the 
company. The average 1 year price target among brokerages that have covered the stock in the last year is $76.50.  
A number of brokerages recently issued reports on RYAAY. Raymond James dropped their price target on shares 
of Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and set an "outperform" rating on the stock in a research note on Thursday, July 
11th. Canaccord Genuity cut shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on 
Wednesday, June 5th. Societe Generale cut shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research 
note on Tuesday, August 6th. HSBC cut shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "reduce" rating in a research 
note on Wednesday, May 22nd. Finally, Credit Suisse Group cut shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an 
"underperform" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 23rd. 
Shares of RYAAY stock  opened at $59.64 on Friday. Ryanair has a 12 month low of $55.75 and a 12 month high 
of $99.89. The stock has a market cap of $13.97 billion, a PE ratio of 11.60 and a beta of 0.79. The company has a 
current ratio of 1.08, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79. The company's fifty day moving average 
price is $60.13 and its 200-day moving average price is $68.48.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the Zacks' consensus estimate of $1.14 
by $0.06. The company had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $2.60 
billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%.  On average, sell-side analysts 
forecast that  Ryanair will post 4.07 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
A number of institutional investors and hedge funds have recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY. Atria 
Investments LLC lifted its stake in  Ryanair by 368,237.8% during the 2nd quarter. Atria Investments LLC now owns 
11,591,591 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $11,592,000 after acquiring an additional 
11,588,444 shares during the period.  Lazard Asset Management LLC lifted its stake in  Ryanair by 39.6% during 
the 1st quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC now owns 6,533,662 shares of the transportation company's stock 
valued at $489,632,000 after acquiring an additional 1,854,616 shares during the period.  Janus Henderson Group 
PLC lifted its stake in  Ryanair by 25.4% during the 2nd quarter. Janus Henderson Group PLC now owns 2,979,797 
shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $191,124,000 after acquiring an additional 603,738 shares 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Given Consensus Rating of "Hold" by Analysts
during the period.  Baillie Gifford & Co. lifted its stake in  Ryanair by 9.0% during the 2nd quarter. Baillie Gifford &

IAG/British Airways: life of Bryanair
IAG/British Airways: life of Bryanair
Financial Times (London, England)
September 7, 2019 Saturday
Edition 1, European Edition
Copyright 2019 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 20
Length: 320 words
Body
A European airline in a clash with trade unions. A dominating boss. Cabin services cut back. A knack for quickly 
filling the Twittersphere with abuse.
British Airways has begun to resemble low-cost Ryanair. BA's pilots plan to walk out on Monday over pay. 
Additional strikes will follow if the airline does not resume negotiations, their union warned yesterday.
Ryanair, headed by Michael O'Leary, has so far avoided massive disruption from similar recent action by its pilots.
Strikes at BA would be more effective and brand damage greater. Some travellers will curse Willie Walsh, chief 
executive of parent IAG. Its shares, however, should remain among the airline sector's better performers.
For many passengers, BA long ago became Bryanair, an airline charging them more than Ryanair for a service only 
marginally more comfortable. Two weeks ago, some were mistakenly told flights on non-strike days had been 
cancelled. It did not add to the fun. A reputation for IT incompetence followed a power outage two years ago, which 
grounded hundreds of flights.
Shareholders worry how IAG will meet EU ownership rules in a no-deal Brexit. European short-haul travel is also in 
the middle of a price war.
Assuming Brexit fallout is navigated, however, IAG should be among the winners, especially if sector consolidation 
ensues. BA's 2017 technical glitch cost around £75m. A strike bill 10 times that would be only a fifth of last year's 
operating profits.
IAG/British Airways: life of Bryanair
IAG stock has fallen 37 per cent over the past year. Since its creation in early 2011, however, they have delivered 
total returns of 90 per cent. Rival Lufthansa generated 13 per cent.
At four times forward earnings, IAG's shares trade at a multiple barely higher than their five-year low. The 
proportion of analysts with them on "buy" last month reached the highest since the Brexit referendum. Investors 
may follow their recommendations. They do not have to fly on BA, though.
Load-Date: September 6, 2019
End of Document
IAG / British Airways : life of Bryanair
IAG/British Airways: life of Bryanair
Financial Times (London, England)
September 7, 2019 Saturday
Edition 1, Asian Edition
Copyright 2019 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 18
Length: 320 words
Body
A European airline in a clash with trade unions. A dominating boss. Cabin services cut back. A knack for quickly 
filling the Twittersphere with abuse.
British Airways has begun to resemble low-cost Ryanair. BA's pilots plan to walk out on Monday over pay. 
Additional strikes will follow if the airline does not resume negotiations, their union warned yesterday.
Ryanair, headed by Michael O'Leary, has so far avoided massive disruption from similar recent action by its pilots.
Strikes at BA would be more effective and brand damage greater. Some travellers will curse Willie Walsh, chief 
executive of parent IAG. Its shares, however, should remain among the airline sector's better performers.
For many passengers, BA long ago became Bryanair, an airline charging them more than Ryanair for a service only 
marginally more comfortable. Two weeks ago, some were mistakenly told flights on non-strike days had been 
cancelled. It did not add to the fun. A reputation for IT incompetence followed a power outage two years ago, which 
grounded hundreds of flights.
Shareholders worry how IAG will meet EU ownership rules in a no-deal Brexit. European short-haul travel is also in 
the middle of a price war.
Assuming Brexit fallout is navigated, however, IAG should be among the winners, especially if sector consolidation 
ensues. BA's 2017 technical glitch cost around £75m. A strike bill 10 times that would be only a fifth of last year's 
operating profits.
IAG / British Airways : life of Bryanair
IAG stock has fallen 37 per cent over the past year. Since its creation in early 2011, however, they have delivered 
total returns of 90 per cent. Rival Lufthansa generated 13 per cent.
At four times forward earnings, IAG's shares trade at a multiple barely higher than their five-year low. The 
proportion of analysts with them on "buy" last month reached the highest since the Brexit referendum. Investors 
may follow their recommendations. They do not have to fly on BA, though.

Renaissance Technologies LLC Sells 35,000 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Renaissance Technologies LLC Sells 35,000 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
September 6, 2019 Friday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 740 words
Body
Ryanair logo Renaissance Technologies LLC reduced its holdings in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 1.0% during the second quarter, according to the company in its most recent disclosure with 
the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The institutional investor  owned 3,396,619 shares of the 
transportation company's stock after selling 35,000 shares during the quarter. Renaissance Technologies LLC 
owned 1.45% of Ryanair worth $217,859,000 as of its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission (SEC).  
A number of other institutional investors have also recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY. Manchester 
Financial Inc. purchased a new stake in  Ryanair during the second quarter valued at $35,000.  Huntington National 
Bank increased its position in  Ryanair by 21.2% during the second quarter. Huntington National Bank now owns 
2,014 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $129,000 after acquiring an additional 352 shares 
during the last quarter.  Quantamental Technologies LLC increased its position in  Ryanair by 89.4% in the second 
quarter. Quantamental Technologies LLC now owns 3,269 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$210,000 after buying an additional 1,543 shares in the last quarter.  GYL Financial Synergies LLC purchased a 
new stake in  Ryanair in the first quarter worth about $224,000.  Finally, LPL Financial LLC increased its position in  
Ryanair by 21.4% in the second quarter. LPL Financial LLC now owns 4,219 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $271,000 after buying an additional 743 shares in the last quarter. Institutional investors 
own  46.03% of the company's stock.  
A number of brokerages have commented on RYAAY. Deutsche Bank upgraded Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a 
"buy" rating in a research report on Friday, June 7th. Credit Suisse Group cut Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an 
"underperform" rating in a research report on Tuesday, July 23rd. JPMorgan Chase & Co. cut Ryanair from a 
"neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a research report on Monday, July 29th. BidaskClub cut Ryanair from a 
"sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a research report on Tuesday, July 30th. Finally, Canaccord Genuity cut 
Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Wednesday, June 5th. Seven research 
analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have assigned  a hold rating and four have assigned  a buy 
rating to the stock. Ryanair  has an average rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $75.33. 
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  traded up $1.00 during trading on Friday, hitting $59.85. The company had a trading 
volume of 200,923 shares, compared to its average volume of 537,147. The stock has a market cap of $13.58 
billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 11.64 and a beta of 0.79. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of $55.75 and 
Renaissance Technologies LLC Sells 35,000 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
a one year high of $99.89. The company has a fifty day simple moving average of $60.23 and a two-hundred day 
simple moving average of $68.54. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a current ratio of 1.08 and a 
quick ratio of 1.08.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. 
Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%. The firm had revenue of $2.60 billion for the 
quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $2.60 billion.  On average, equities research analysts anticipate 
that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.07 earnings per share for the current year.  
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Bank of Montreal Can Acquires 74,492 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Bank of Montreal Can Acquires 74,492 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
September 5, 2019 Thursday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 654 words
Body
Ryanair logo Bank of Montreal Can boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 
24.9% during the 2nd quarter, according to its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The 
firm owned 373,986 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 74,492 shares 
during the quarter. Bank of Montreal Can owned about 0.16% of Ryanair worth $23,987,000 at the end of the most 
recent quarter.  
A number of other institutional investors and hedge funds have also modified their holdings of the stock. 
Manchester Financial Inc. purchased a new position in  Ryanair during the 2nd quarter valued at approximately 
$35,000.  Quantamental Technologies LLC purchased a new position in  Ryanair during the 1st quarter valued at 
approximately $129,000.  Huntington National Bank grew its holdings in  Ryanair by 21.2% during the 2nd quarter. 
Huntington National Bank now owns 2,014 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $129,000 after 
buying an additional 352 shares in the last quarter.  GYL Financial Synergies LLC purchased a new position in  
Ryanair during the 1st quarter valued at approximately $224,000.  Finally, Campbell & CO Investment Adviser LLC 
purchased a new position in  Ryanair during the 1st quarter valued at approximately $277,000. 47.17% of the stock 
is currently owned by institutional investors.  
Shares of Ryanair stock  opened at $57.97 on Thursday. The stock has a market cap of $13.42 billion, a price-to-
earnings ratio of 11.28 and a beta of 0.79. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a quick ratio of 1.08 and 
a current ratio of 1.08. The stock has a 50 day moving average price of $60.34 and a 200-day moving average price 
of $68.61. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of $55.75 and a one year high of $99.89.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company 
reported $1.20 EPS for the quarter, topping the Zacks' consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. The firm had revenue 
of $2.60 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $2.60 billion. Ryanair had a return on 
equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%.  Sell-side analysts predict that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.07 
earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
Several equities analysts have weighed in on RYAAY shares. BidaskClub cut Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a 
"strong sell" rating in a report on Tuesday, July 30th. Canaccord Genuity cut Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" 
rating in a report on Wednesday, June 5th. Societe Generale cut Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a 
report on Tuesday, August 6th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. cut Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" 
rating in a report on Monday, July 29th. Finally, Deutsche Bank upgraded Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" 
Bank of Montreal Can Acquires 74,492 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
rating in a report on Friday, June 7th. Seven analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have issued  a 
hold rating and four have assigned  a buy rating to the company. Ryanair presently has a consensus rating of 
"Hold" and an average target price of $75.33. 
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 67.2% during the 2nd quarter, according to the company in its most recent filing with the 
SEC. The institutional investor  owned 58,896 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an 
additional 23,665 shares during the period. Ryanair accounts for  0.4% of Global Endowment Management LP's 
investment portfolio, making the stock its 26th biggest holding. Global Endowment Management LP's holdings in 
Ryanair were worth $3,778,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period.  
A number of other hedge funds and other institutional investors have also recently bought and sold shares of the 
business. BB&T Corp grew its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 38.1% during the 2nd quarter. BB&T Corp now 
owns 6,103 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $391,000 after acquiring an additional 1,684 
shares in the last quarter.  Baldwin Investment Management LLC grew its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 3.3% 
during the 1st quarter. Baldwin Investment Management LLC now owns 9,341 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $700,000 after acquiring an additional 300 shares in the last quarter.  First Pacific 
Advisors LP grew its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 9.3% during the 1st quarter. First Pacific Advisors LP now 
owns 78,303 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $5,868,000 after acquiring an additional 6,690 
shares in the last quarter.  WCM Investment Management LLC grew its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 1.5% 
during the 1st quarter. WCM Investment Management LLC now owns 4,339,799 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $325,225,000 after acquiring an additional 62,671 shares in the last quarter.  Finally, 
Parametric Portfolio Associates LLC grew its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 7.0% during the 1st quarter.

$11,726,000 after acquiring an additional 10,230 shares in the last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional 
investors own  46.03% of the company's stock.  
Several research firms recently issued reports on RYAAY. Credit Suisse Group lowered shares of Ryanair from a 
"neutral" rating to an "underperform" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 23rd. Societe Generale lowered 
shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Tuesday, August 6th. JPMorgan

Monday, July 29th. Raymond James reduced their price objective on shares of Ryanair from $80.00 to $77.00 and

investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, three have assigned  a hold rating and four have given a 
buy rating to the stock. The stock  has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average target price of $75.33. 
RYAAY stock  opened at $57.97 on Thursday. The company has a current ratio of 1.08, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a 
debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 1 year low of $55.75 and a 1 year high of $99.89. The 
company has a fifty day simple moving average of $60.34 and a 200 day simple moving average of $68.61. The 
firm has a market cap of $13.51 billion, a PE ratio of 11.28 and a beta of 0.79.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation company 
reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the Zacks' consensus estimate of $1.14 by $0.06. The 
firm had revenue of $2.60 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 billion. Ryanair had a 
net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%.  As a group, analysts forecast that  Ryanair Holdings plc 
will post 4.07 EPS for the current fiscal year.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair logo Wells Fargo & Company MN increased its stake in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) 
by 20.8% in the second quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The fund owned 
395,892 shares of the transportation company's stock after buying an additional 68,285 shares during the period. 
Wells Fargo & Company MN owned about 0.17% of Ryanair worth $25,393,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.  
A number of other hedge funds and other institutional investors also recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY.

Management LLC now owns 6,533,662 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $489,632,000 after 
purchasing an additional 1,854,616 shares in the last quarter.  WCM Investment Management LLC boosted its 
position in shares of  Ryanair by 1.5% in the first quarter. WCM Investment Management LLC now owns 4,339,799 
shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $325,225,000 after acquiring an additional 62,671 shares 
during the period.  Janus Henderson Group PLC boosted its position in shares of  Ryanair by 25.4% in the second

now owns 1,943,636 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $145,656,000 after acquiring an 
additional 251,125 shares during the period.  Finally, Caisse DE Depot ET Placement DU Quebec boosted its

163,800 shares during the period. Institutional investors and hedge funds own  46.03% of the company's stock.

Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underperform" rating in a research report on Tuesday, July 23rd. JPMorgan 
Chase & Co. lowered shares of Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an "underweight" rating in a research report on 
Monday, July 29th. Societe Generale lowered shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research

in a research report on Wednesday, June 5th. Finally, BidaskClub lowered shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to 
a "strong sell" rating in a research report on Tuesday, July 30th. Seven analysts have rated the stock with a sell 
rating, three have given a hold rating and four have given a buy rating to the company's stock. The company 
currently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus price target of $75.33. 
Wells Fargo & Company MN Boosts Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Ryanair stock  traded up $1.10 during mid-day trading on Thursday, hitting $59.07. 5,377 shares of the company 
traded hands, compared to its average volume of 542,033. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of $55.75 and 
a one year high of $99.89. The stock has a market cap of $13.51 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 11.53 and a 
beta of 0.79. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a current ratio of 1.08. The 
stock has a fifty day moving average price of $60.34 and a 200-day moving average price of $68.61.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, topping the Zacks' consensus estimate of $1.14 by 
$0.06. The firm had revenue of $2.60 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $2.60 billion. 
Ryanair had a net margin of 10.47% and a return on equity of 18.39%.  Sell-side analysts predict that  Ryanair 
Holdings plc will post 4.07 EPS for the current year.  
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair and Wizz Air's passenger numbers enjoy take off in August
Ryanair and Wizz Air's passenger numbers enjoy take off in August
City A.M.
September 4, 2019 Wednesday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 City A.M. All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; TEASERS; Pg. 10
Length: 201 words
Byline: ALEXANDRA ROGERS
Body
BUDGET airlines Ryanair and Wizz Air both enjoyed an uptick in passenger numbers in August, with the latter 
enjoying a record-breaking month.
Hungary-based Wizz Air has recently announced 23 new routes across Europe, including to Ukraine and Georgia, 
and has also expanded its fleet with two new Airbus 321neo aircraft and two Airbus 321ceo models, taking its entire 
fleet to 119.
Passenger numbers rose to 4.03m as the company passed the 4m monthly mark for the first time.
Wizz's load factor rose 0.7 percentage points to 96.3 per cent.
Ryanair pilots who are members of the British Airline Pilots' Association (Balpa) walked out on 22 August, although 
the airline was able to minimise disruption thanks to the "volunteerism" of its UK pilots.
A strike by the same union is currently underway and is expected to come to an end today.
Ryanair has again said it is operating a normal schedule.
"We do not expect any strikerelated disruptions to our flights to/from our UK airports," said Ryanair.
"On behalf of our customers and their families, we wish to thank all our UK pilots who did not support Balpa's strike 
and have chosen to work to protect the flights and travel plans of our customers and their families."
Load-Date: September 4, 2019
Ryanair and Wizz Air's passenger numbers enjoy take off in August
End of Document
Ryanair Holdings ' UK Pilots to Strike for Another Week
Ryanair Holdings' UK Pilots to Strike for Another Week
MT Newswires Live Briefs
September 4, 2019 Wednesday 8:54 PM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 73 words
Body
 Ryanair Holdings' (RYAAY)  UK pilots union has decided to strike for another seven days.
Members of the British Airline Pilots Association decided to walkout on Sept. 18, 19, 21, 23, 25, 27 and 29, as the 
current strike is coming to an end.
Spanish pilots will also be on strike on Sept 19, 27 and 29, while the ninth of 10 strike days called by their cabin 
crew colleagues is due on Sept. 27.
Price: 57.97, Change: 0.00, Percent Change: 0.00
Load-Date: September 5, 2019

A Passengers' Guide to Surviving Airline Strike Season
A Passengers' Guide to Surviving Airline Strike Season
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
September 04, 2019
Copyright 2019 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 196 words
Body
For those who are planning a vacation anytime soon, be warned, your flight could be affected by strikes.
Just today, Ryanair pilots union announced it will strike for another seven days in September. British Airways pilots 
are also set to go on strike on September 9 and September 10 and then again on September 27 potentially 
impacting travel for thousands of passengers.
All of this comes after a massive pilot strike at SAS in April and May left more than 370,000 passengers stranded at 
airports.
AirGuide Travel Media connects you to an affluent, influential group of business and leisure travelers from across 
the globe with Frequent Flyer Destinations Magazine, AirGuideOnline, AirGuide Destination Travel Guides, 
AirGuideBusiness. Editorial eMail: edit@AirGuideOnline.com
For Advertising
For Travel Tech and Content Solutions. Our Technology & Content Services will reduce your content costs and 
build revenue. We have the ability to integrate and distribute content into virtually any platform or language. Works 
on any Website, WebMobile, Apps, WiFi, Airport or Inflight IFE/W-IFE, InRail, InHotel, InCruise platform.
Air & Travel Business Analysis: bizintel@AirGuideOnline.com

Ryanair logo Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset Management Co. Ltd. grew its position in  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 58.9% in the 2nd quarter, according to its most recent filing with the SEC. The firm owned 
21,400 shares of the transportation company's stock after buying an additional 7,935 shares during the period. 
Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset Management Co. Ltd.'s holdings in Ryanair were worth $1,373,000 at the end of the 
most recent reporting period.  
Several other hedge funds and other institutional investors have also recently added to or reduced their stakes in 
RYAAY. Manchester Financial Inc. acquired a new stake in shares of  Ryanair in the 2nd quarter valued at $35,000.  
Quadrant Capital Group LLC grew its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 69.7% during the first quarter. Quadrant Capital 
Group LLC now owns 1,583 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $116,000 after purchasing an 
additional 650 shares during the period.  Quantamental Technologies LLC acquired a new stake in shares of  
Ryanair during the first quarter worth $129,000.  Huntington National Bank grew its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 
21.2% during the second quarter. Huntington National Bank now owns 2,014 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $129,000 after purchasing an additional 352 shares during the period.  Finally, GYL 
Financial Synergies LLC acquired a new stake in shares of  Ryanair during the first quarter worth $224,000. 47.17% 
of the stock is owned by institutional investors.  
RYAAY  traded down $0.10 on Tuesday, hitting $57.20. 1,023 shares of the company were exchanged, compared 
to its average volume of 552,174. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12 month low of $55.75 and a 12 month high of 
$102.93. The company has a market cap of $13.42 billion, a PE ratio of 11.10 and a beta of 0.79. The company has 
a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.79, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a current ratio of 1.08. The stock's fifty day moving average 
is $60.59 and its 200-day moving average is $68.75.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings results on Monday, July 29th. The transportation 
company reported $1.20 earnings per share for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus estimates of $1.14 by 
$0.06. The firm had revenue of $2.60 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $2.60 billion. 
Ryanair had a return on equity of 18.39% and a net margin of 10.47%.  As a group, equities research analysts 
expect that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.07 EPS for the current fiscal year.

sell" rating in a research note on Tuesday, July 30th. Societe Generale cut Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold"

rating in a research note on Tuesday, August 6th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. cut Ryanair from a "neutral" rating to an

Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website. 
Featured Article: G-20

filings and insider trades for Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY).

FTSE 100 Subdued As Brexit Showdown Kicks Off
FTSE 100 Subdued As Brexit Showdown Kicks Off
RTT News (United States)
September 3, 2019 Tuesday
Copyright 2019 Content Engine, LLC.
All Rights Reserved
Copyright 2019 RTT News All Rights Reserved
Length: 206 words
Byline: editorial@rttnews.com,  (RTT Staff Writer)
Body
       U.K. shares were marginally lower on Tuesday and the pound hovered near a three-year low against the dollar 
as MPs opposed to Prime Minister Boris Johnson prepare their bid to delay Brexit.
 The benchmark FTSE 100 was down 13 points, or 0.18 percent, at 7,268 after rallying 1 percent the previous day. 
 Ryanair fell 1.4 percent despite the airline reporting an 8 percent rise in group traffic for the month of August. 
 Ferguson, a specialist distributor of plumbing and heating products, jumped 2.3 percent after announcing its 
intention to demerge its U.K. operations.
 Restaurant Group plunged 11.5 percent as it posted a loss for the first six months of 2019 after the unpopular 
Wagamama purchase.
 Tesco dropped 1.4 percent as Lloyds Banking Group agreed to buy its mortgage book in a £3.8bn deal.
 In economic releases, U.K. construction sector contracted for the fourth consecutive month in August as new work 
declined the most in over ten years, leading business optimism to plummet to over a decade-low, data from IHS 
Markit's purchasing managers' survey showed.
 The IHS Markit/CIPS UK Construction Total Activity Index fell to 45 from 45.3 in July. Economists had forecast a 
modest improvement in the reading to 45.9.        
Load-Date: September 4, 2019
End of Document
European Shares Edge Lower Amid Brexit Showdown
European Shares Edge Lower Amid Brexit Showdown
RTT News (United States)
September 3, 2019 Tuesday
Copyright 2019 Content Engine, LLC.
All Rights Reserved
Copyright 2019 RTT News All Rights Reserved
Length: 232 words
Byline: editorial@rttnews.com,  (RTT Staff Writer)
Body
       European stocks were moving lower for the first time in four sessions on Tuesday as British PM faced a 
showdown in Parliament over Brexit and investors waited for more clarity on the U.S.-China trade talks. 
 British PM Boris Johnson will call a general election for October 14th if he loses a Commons vote later today aimed 
at blocking a no-deal Brexit.
 Investors also kept an eye on the European Central Bank's meeting next week, where it is widely expected to cut 
interest rates to bolster growth.
 The pan European Stoxx 600 was down 0.4 percent at 379.22 after rising 0.3 percent in the previous session. 
 The German DAX was losing 0.4 percent, France's CAC 40 index was declining 0.6 percent and the U.K.'s FTSE 
100 was down 0.3 percent. 
 Shares of Thyssenkrupp tumbled 3.2 percent. The German industrial company will be moved from the DAX to the 
smaller MDAX index on Wednesday.
 Ryanair fell 1.4 percent despite the airline reporting an 8 percent rise in group traffic for the month of August. 
 Ferguson, a specialist distributor of plumbing and heating products, jumped 2.3 percent after announcing its 
intention to demerge its U.K. operations.
 Restaurant Group plunged 11.5 percent as it posted a loss for the first six months of 2019 after the unpopular 
Wagamama purchase.
 Tesco dropped 1.4 percent as Lloyds Banking Group agreed to buy its mortgage book in a £3.8bn deal.

Ryanair Continues Flights as Scheduled Despite UK Pilots Strike
Ryanair Continues Flights as Scheduled Despite UK Pilots Strike
MT Newswires Live Briefs
September 3, 2019 Tuesday 5:44 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 115 words
Body
 Ryanair (RYAAY) continued its flights to and from Britain as scheduled despite the second round of strikes by UK 
pilots over pay and working conditions, according to media reports. 
The three-day strike is aimed at pushing the budget carrier to give members of the British Airline Pilots' Association 
(BALPA) a pay increase and other benefits such as adequate pension and transparent pay structure, according to 
reports Monday. 
The union has accused the airliner of using contractors who are not entitled to join unions to keep its operations 
running. 
BALPA General Secretary Brian Strutton reportedly said Ryanair has not given any offer yet. 
Price: 57.30, Change: -0.20, Percent Change: -0.35
Load-Date: September 4, 2019
End of Document
Ryanair Aug. Group Traffic Up 8% - Quick Facts
Ryanair Aug. Group Traffic Up 8% - Quick Facts
RTT News (United States)
September 3, 2019 Tuesday
Copyright 2019 Content Engine, LLC.
All Rights Reserved
Copyright 2019 RTT News All Rights Reserved
Length: 88 words
Byline: editorial@rttnews.com,  (RTT Staff Writer)
Body
       Ryanair Holdings plc (RYA.L) reported Group traffic of 14.9 million customers for the month of August, up 8 
percent from 13.8 million prior year. Load factor was 97%, for the month of August. Ryanair operated over 81,000 
scheduled flights in August. 
 For the month of August, Ryanair alone recorded traffic growth of 8%, while Lauda reported traffic growth of 20%.
 For the rolling annual period, traffic was 149.2 million customers, up 10 percent from 135.5 million previous year. 
Load factor was 96%, for the period.

Airline Stock Roundup: AAL UAL Extend 737 MAX Grounding Period, ALK in Focus
Airline Stock Roundup: AAL UAL Extend 737 MAX Grounding Period, ALK in 
Focus
Newstex Blogs 
Zacks Investment Research
September 3, 2019 Tuesday 3:06 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1574 words
Byline: Maharathi Basu
Body
Sep 03, 2019( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  In the past week, 
American Airlines AAL[1] and United Airlines UAL[2] extended the grounding period of Boeing 737 Max jets in their 
respective fleets. Currently, American Airlines and United Airlines have 24 and 14 such jets, respectively.A couple 
of updates were also available from Alaska Air Group's ALK[3] wholly-owned subsidiary — Alaska Airlines — in the 
past week. The carrier announced the ratifications [4]of two pay-related labor deals and also issued an update 
related to its expansion on the West Coast. An expansion-related update was available from Delta Air Lines DAL[5] 
as well.European low-cost carrier, Ryanair Holdings RYAAY[6] too grabbed headlines by virtue of its decision to 
announce a change at the helm of the group's biggest airline, Ryanair DAC. 
The Irish carrier also announced an 8% increase in its August traffic.(Read the Last Airline Stock Roundup 
here[7]).Recap of Past Week's Most Important Stories1. Updates on Boeing 737 MAX jets have been flooding the 
aviation space ever since the deadly Ethiopian Airlines' crash on Mar 10, 2019. In fact, this was the second 
accident involving Boeing 737 MAX jets within a span of five months. The same model had crashed in Indonesia 
during October 2018, killing 189 people.The latest update came from American Airlines that suspended operations 
of its Boeing 737 Max jets until Dec 3, 2019, extending the grounding period from the previously announced Nov 2. 
American Airlines anticipates approximately 140 flights to be canceled per day through Dec 3. Also, United Airlines 
expects 737 MAX jets in its fleet to remain grounded through Dec 19 as opposed to Nov 3, expected earlier. 
Notably, Southwest Airlines LUV[8], which has 34 such jets in its fleet, had announced earlier that it will remove 
Boeing 737 MAX jets from its schedule until Jan 5, 2020. (Read more: American Airlines Extends Boeing 737 MAX 
Grounding Period[9])2. In a bid to expand its presence in the West Coast, Alaska Airlines announced that it aims to 
add eight new routes connecting the 'vibrant Pacific Northwest communities' with California cities like Los Angeles 
and San Francisco. For instance, there will be two daily departures from Spokane to Los Angeles and San 
Francisco each. While some of the above flights (for example, Spokane to Los Angeles) will start operations from 
Jan 7, 2020, most others (for example, Spokane to San Francisco, Missoula to Los Angeles) will take to the skies 
from Mar 19. (Read more: Alaska Airlines to Boost West Coast Presence With New Routes[10])3. To meet the 
surge in demand during the upcoming winter season, Delta intends to ramp up services to popular Caribbean 
destinations from its hubs. To this end, the carrier aims to launch an additional daily flight from Dec 21, 2019, in the 
New York John F. Kennedy Airport (JFK)-Luis Munoz Marin International Airport (SJU) route. Post commencement 
Airline Stock Roundup: AAL UAL Extend 737 MAX Grounding Period, ALK in Focus
of this new service, Delta will offer a total of four daily flights on the same route. (Read more: Delta to Boost 
Caribbean Services From Its Hubs This Winter[11])Delta carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). You can see the complete 
list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here[12].4. Ryanair, which operates as a holding group company 
and includes several airlines, stated that highly-experienced Eddie Wilson has replaced Michael O'Leary as chief 
executive officer (CEO) of the group's biggest airline, Ryanair DAC, with immediate effect. Notably, Wilson has 
been associated with the airline for 22 years. O'Leary will, however, continue to function as the group's 
CEO.Additionally, Ryanair's August traffic report was impressive, with the metric (including 0.6 million from its 
LaudaMotion unit) increasing 8% year over year to 14.9 million. However, the load factor remained unaltered at 
97%. The carrier operated more than 81,000 scheduled flights in August.5. Azul's AZUL[13] cargo division — Azul 
Cargo Express — has entered into a new agreement with Mercado Libre, the largest e-commerce company in Latin 
America, for deliveries across Brazil. The two companies have started working together earlier this year. Presently, 
Azul derives 10% of its cargo revenues from Mercado Libre. The company's cargo business is benefiting 
immensely from rapid e-commerce growth. Notably, its cargo revenues increased 44% during the first half of 2019. 
The new deal should further fortify its cargo operations.PerformanceThe following table shows the price movement 
of the major airline players over the past week and during the last six months.The table above shows that all airline 
stocks traded in the green over the past week, resulting in the NYSE ARCA Airline Index gaining 3.8% to $92.89. 
Over the course of six months, the same depreciated 3.5% due to double-digit losses at the likes of Spirit Airlines 
and American Airlines.What's Next in the Airline Space?Investors will look forward to August traffic reports from the 
likes of SkyWest in the coming days. Updates on the impact of Hurricane Dorian on airline operations will also be 
awaited.Legalizing THIS Could Be Even Bigger than MarijuanaAmericans spend an estimated $150 billion in this 
industry every year more than twice as much as they spend on marijuana.Now that 8 states have fully-legalized it 
(with several more states following close behind), Zacks has identified 5 stocks that could soar in response to the

Ryanair Picks Eddie Wilson as Chief Executive of Main Airline
Ryanair Picks Eddie Wilson as Chief Executive of Main Airline
Newstex Blogs 
Zacks Investment Research
September 3, 2019 Tuesday 3:31 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 839 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Sep 03, 2019( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Per Reuters[1], Ryanair 
Holdings plc RYAAY[2] recently appointed Eddie Wilson as the chief executive of its core airline business. 
Meanwhile, Michael O'Leary has been promoted to chief executive officer of Ryanair Group that includes 
Laudamotion and Buzz brands.Wilson, a Ryanair-veteran of 22 years took charge on Sep 1 and reports to O'Leary. 
Previously, he served as the chief people officer and was responsible for negotiations with unions for the past two 
years.A few weeks earlier, O'Leary announced that Peter Bellew would resign from his position as chief operations 
officer at the end of this year. Prior to this announcement, there were speculations of Peter Bellew becoming the 
new 
chief 
executive.Ryanair

between Ryanair and the union leaders, its Spanish cabin crew warned of a 10-day strike in September (1, 2, 6, 8, 
13, 15, 20, 22, 27 and 29). Meanwhile, the carrier's British pilots began a three-day strike (which the airline believes 
will have minimal impact on travel). The airline staff is protesting against a poor pay structure and bad work

On the block: a look at airport sales around the world
On the block: a look at airport sales around the world
MarketLine NewsWire (Formerly Datamonitor)
September 2, 2019 Monday 6:30 AM GMT
Copyright 2019 MarketLine All Rights Reserved
Section: AUTOMOTIVE, TRANSPORT AND LOGISTICS
Length: 1079 words
Highlight: Airports are often seen as lucrative money trees, capable of attracting airlines and investors across a 
wide range of departments including retail and advertising.
Body
As recent figures from the Airport Council International (ACI) show, global airport industry revenues generated over 
$172bn in 2017, making it a very profitable market for companies around the world. Financial prosperity is however, 
not something that all hubs can boast. Poor traffic rates and scarce lack of funds are only some of the causes 
behind some airports' economic misery, though often times, they make for a good reason for owners to put them on 
sale. In June this year, Glasgow's Prestwick Airport, in Scotland, fell victim to misfortune and was put up on the 
market by the Scottish Government after yet another year of financial losses. 
Several other airports have faced a similar fate over the past few years, in some occasions as part of privatisation 
moves and in others, simply because they failed to generate enough revenue. Here's a look at some of the most 
curious episodes of airports put on sale around the world and the reasons behind their downfall. Prestwick Airport, 
UK Fresh from being put on the market just a few months ago, Prestwick Airport's future is still hanging by a thread, 
with deadline for bids set for 6 September. Outrage exploded among airport unions when the Scottish Government 
announced plans to sell it at the beginning of the holiday season, with many pointing to the negative impacts its sale 
could have on employees and the South Ayrshire area where it is based. Yet as concerning as it might be, the 
decision should not have come as a surprise to many, with the ill-fated hub having long suffered dwindling 
passenger rates and business opportunities. Years of financial misery had, in fact, previously convinced former 
owner Infratil to put Prestwick on the market, having incurred losses of £2m in 2012. The company eventually found 
a buyer - the Scottish Government - in 2013 and agreed to the sale for a rather modest fee of £1. But not even the 
£40m loans it received from Holyrood managed to keep it alive, as figures from January 2019 showed the hub's 
debt had amounted to about £38.4m. As the September deadline looms, Ryanair is currently the only airline 
operating at Prestwick. Ciudad Real Central Airport, Spain The history of Spain's (EURO)1bn Ciudad Real Central 
Airport - previously known as Don Quijote Airport - is one that still baffles many. Located a couple of hours from the 
capital Madrid, in the Ciudad Real region, it was meant to become the pride of Spain and serve ten million travellers 
a year. Instead, a decade since its construction, it's one of the most prominent victims of Spain's recession years, 
On the block: a look at airport sales around the world
which turned it into an almost entirely unused emblem of the country's past struggles. Three years after its 
pompous opening, it was abruptly shut down in 2012 due to the owning company's financial difficulties and a steep 
decline in flights. The unfortunate hub was then put up on sale twice between 2012 and 2015; although a couple of 
foreign investors initially showed interest, they never went far enough to close in on a deal, leaving the abandoned 
to roast under the Spanish sun. Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport, Sri Lanka Bad luck has been haunting the 
southern Sri Lankan airport of Mattala Rajapaksa almost from when it began operations in 2013. Originally set to 
become the second largest international airport in the country, Mattala Rajapaksa's reputation now precedes it; it is 
now often referred to as the emptiest hub in the world. Having been built on the back of a staggering $190m-worth 
of loans provided by the Bank of China - for a total cost of $210m -  in its first year in operation, it handled a mere 
3,000 flights and served just 21,000 people despite its capacity of one million passengers. With no international 
flights using Mattala Airport as of 2018, the Sri Lankan Government might now have now found a way to restore its 
name. Having been looking for potential buyers since June 2016, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said in 
March that the doomed airport might soon be run in a joint venture with the Indian Aviation Authority. The deal could 
open up to a new range of possibilities - as well as, more importantly, passengers - to the aging hub and the 
community it serves. The BAA's six UK airports Not long ago, several British airports were owned by a single 
company whose local and international prestige threatened to reach concerning levels. Now known as Heathrow 
Airport Holdings, until 2014, the British Airports Authority (BAA) was responsible for operating seven airports in the 
UK, including top names such as Gatwick, Heathrow and Stanstead. Established in the 1960s to handle four British 
hubs, in the space of a few decades, the company's portfolio doubled to include Naples International Airport in Italy, 
the unlucky Glasgow Prestwick and many others. However, its growing monopoly within the UK aviation industry 
became such that it was forced to sell off all of its airports apart from Heathrow, as imposed by the UK Competition 
Commission. As a result, the BAA sold a first batch of hubs - which included Gatwick, Stansted and Edinburgh -
between 2009 and 2013, and another three - Aberdeen, Southampton and Glasgow airports in 2014. Adani Group's 
brand new six airports in India   In November 2018, the Indian Government kicked off a new round of infrastructure 
privatisation by putting six airports - namely Ahmedabad, Jaipur Lucknow, Guwahati, Thiruvananthapuram, and 
Mangaluru - up for sale. However, over the first few months, political uncertainty and mounting debt weighing on the 
shoulders of several infrastructure companies looked likely to compromise the hubs' attractiveness and their future. 
But as of March this year, the six airports have found a more than wealthy benefactor in Indian billionaire Gautam 
Adani, chairman and founder of mines-to-energy conglomerate Adani Group. Adani emerged as the highest bidder 
for the whole batch, whose purchase is going to make the company the third-largest operator in India. The deal was 
not completed without controversy, as different players across the Indian aviation sector claimed Adani has no 
experience within this industry, and hinted his friendship with Prime Minister Narendra Modi determined his success 
over other more established bidders. "The entire bid process appears to be mysterious," said Pinarayi Vijayan, the 
chief minister of Kerala state, after Adani Group had already won five of the six contracts. "If not, how can a single 
person win all the five bids?"
Load-Date: September 9, 2019
End of Document
